Hoping to generate higher income through more sewing services, María Eugenia wants to buy a chain stitch sewing machine but she does not have sufficient capital to do so which is why she hopes to get a loan that will allow her to buy this special sewing machine that will make it possible for her to provide greater services to her customers.  María Eugenia hopes in this way to continue increasing her income to improve the quality of life for her ten children as well as offer them a good education and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a chain stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 27 years old. She runs a pharmacy to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Demaris has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha es una persona reconocida por realizar artesanías de muy buena calidad. Martha aprendió la actividad tomando cursos donde le enseñaron la producción y comercialización de las artesanías. Martha con 42 años de edad se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos; para ella, su familia es lo más importante y por esto siempre busca brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Martha tiene en su negocio muy buenos pedidos, pues sus productos son reconocidos por su buena calidad, y gracias a esto contribuye a los ingresos del hogar para sostener los gastos que se generan. Martha, actualmente tiene un gran pedido de un almacén de productos para bebés, por lo que debe producir una gran cantidad de artesanías. Para esto, debe comprar materia prima que requiere para la fabricación de estas artesanías, y es por esto que recurre a un préstamo en búsqueda de que este le brinde la posibilidad de comprar materias primas con pegantes, madera, telas, entre otros, para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Martha espera que su negocio siga aumentando las ventas, y poder así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos y su esposo. Además, sueña con tener un gran almacén en donde poder exhibir sus artesanías y generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha is a person who is renowned for making very good quality crafts.  She learned the activity taking courses where she was taught how to make and sell crafts.  Martha, 42, is married and the mother of two children.  For her, her family is the most important thing which is why she’s always looking to provide the best quality of life for them.  

Martha has some very good customer orders because her products are renowned for their good quality and thanks to this they contribute toward household income to cover expenses generated.  Martha currently has a big order from a baby products store so she has to produce a large amount of crafts.  To do so, she must buy the raw materials she needs to make them and this is why she’s calling upon a loan hoping that it will afford her the opportunity to buy raw materials like adhesives, wood and fabric, among others, to make her crafts.

Martha hopes that her business will continue increasing sales to provide her husband and two children with a better quality of life.  In addition, she dreams with having a large store where she can display her crafts and generate employment for people who most need it.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 8 wafer making presses.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth se ha caracterizado por ser una persona con mucho talento y creatividad. Desde hace aproximadamente 22 años, Ruth tomó un curso para pintar arte country a través del cual aprendió a realizar esta actividad. Desde entonces y con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, Ruth produce sus artesanías y las vende a grandes clientes que tiene. Actualmente Ruth tiene tantos pedidos que no puede cumplir con algunos que le hacen sus clientes. Gracias a esto, Ruth es reconocida por tener muy buenos productos de muy buena calidad. Además del arte country, Ruth combina su actividad con la confección de lencerías para el hogar, que también lo hace de manera artesanal y también lo vende a sus clientes. Con la combinación de las 2 actividades, Ruth puede contribuir a generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos que se generan en su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. 

Actualmente Ruth tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente, el cual requiere comprar materia prima para poder ser elaborado, es por esto que Ruth tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como pinturas, telas, y diferentes materiales que requiere para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Ruth espera que sus ventas sigan aumentando y sueña con algún día poder tener un gran local donde poder exhibir sus productos. Además, Ruth sueña con que sus 4 hijos tengan acceso a una buena educación y a una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ruth has been characterized as being a person with a lot of talent and creativity. Approximately 22 years ago, Ruth took a class in order to paint country art, through which she learned how to do this activity. Since then, and with the thought of earning necessary income for her household, Ruth has produced her crafts and sold them to large customers she has. Currently, Ruth has so many orders that she cannot keep up with some of the orders her customers place. Thanks to this, Ruth is recognized for having very good products of very good quality. In addition to country art, Ruth makes linen goods for the home, which she also does by hand, and also sells to her customers. With the combination of the two activities, Ruth can contribute to generating the income necessary to cover the expenses of her household, which she shares with her husband and their 4 children.

Currently, Ruth has a large order from a customer that requires the purchase of raw materials in order to do it. This is why Ruth hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to purchase raw materials such as paint, fabric, and various materials that she needs to make her crafts.

Ruth hopes that her sales will continue to increase, and she dreams that one day she will be able to have a large building where she can exhibit her products. Also, Ruth dreams that her 4 children will have access to a good education and economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as paints, fabric, and various materials she needs to make her crafts

loans.name: Hilda Piedad

texts.es:
Hilda se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a trabajar y a brindarle la mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y su hijo de 17 años. Hilda se dedica desde hace un tiempo a la venta de comidas rápidas, y gracias a esta actividad contribuye generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Hilda atiende el negocio de comidas rápidas todos los días y sus clientes tienen gran preferencia por sus productos debido a la buena calidad de los mismos. 

Con el ánimo de ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, Hilda quiere surtir su negocio con un mayor número de gaseosas, licores y cervezas, de modo que sus clientes puedan tener una mayor variedad a la hora de consumir sus comidas rápidas. Sin embargo, Hilda no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de estos productos por lo que espera a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos como gaseosas, licores y cervezas para ofrecer una mayor variedad de líquidos a sus clientes.

Hilda espera que de esta manera sus ventas se incrementen y pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida a su hijo y su esposo. Además, sueña con tener un gran negocio de comidas rápidas donde pueda generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Hilda has spent a great part of her life working to provide her husband and 17-year-old son with a better quality of life.  Hilda has been selling fast food for some time and thanks to this activity is able to generate income to contribute towards household support.  Hilda tends to her fast food business every day and her customers very much prefer her because of the good quality of her products.

Aiming at offering better customer service, Hilda wants to stock her business with a larger number of soft-drinks, liquor and beer so that her customers will have more variety to choose from while consuming their fast food.  However, Hilda does not have sufficient capital to buy these products so is hoping for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy products like soft-drinks, liquor and beer to offer a wider variety of beverages to her customers.

Hilda hopes in this way to increase sales and improve her son’s and her husband’s quality of life.  In addition, she dreams with having a great fast food business where she can generate employment for those who need it the most.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, liquor and beer.

loans.name: Gloria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos de los cuales dos viven con ella.

Ella se ha dedicado a administrar su propia tienda de productos básicos y desde hace cinco años se dedica también a la sastrería como empleada de una señora. Ella compra los insumos en una ciudad del oriente del país por lo que se desplaza unos cuarenta kilómetros desde su casa hasta la ciudad y este viaje lo realiza dos veces al mes.

El  préstamo que solicita es para comprar una maquina de cozer industrial tipo rana, para poder trabajar por cuenta propia elaborando los uniformes para los estudiantes de las escuelas publicas y ya no como empleada sino como dueña. Así ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos económicos y brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La señora Gloria pretende crear un puesto de sastrería en la comunidad e instalar una escuela de sastrería para poder enseñar el oficio a otras personas que desean aprenderlo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are living with her.

She has dedicated herself to running her own store selling basic products. For the past five years, she has also worked in tailoring, as the employee of another woman. She buys her supplies in a city in the east of the country, for which she travels some 40 kilometers from her home to the city. She undertakes this journey twice a month. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy an industrial overlock type sewing machine, so that she can work independently making uniforms for the public school students, no longer as an employee but as a business owner. Thus she will be able to earn a better income and provide a better quality of life to her family. Gloria plans to set up a tailoring shop in her community and include a tailoring school, so that she can teach the profession to others who would like to learn it.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock type sewing machine.

loans.name: Durel Persyl

texts.fr:
Client age de 30 ans, celibataire sans enfant, il se lance dans la prestation des services des jeux électroniques  en 2006 en ouvrant une salle de jeu et maintenant il a achète  plusieurs téléviseurs et un groupe électrogène en cas de coupure d'électricité pour elargir son activité.

Ses prêts ont apportes un grand impact dans sa vie sociale, ses recettes ont accrus, il a une forte clientèle et sa vie a complétement changée.
Il arrive a épargner sans difficulté et vit normalement et en tant que jeune il est entrain de se battre pour atteindre ses objectifs , construire une maison dans la parcelle familiale et se marier dans peu de temps et aussi chercher un autre endroit pour ouvrir une autre salle de jeu
texts.en:
This borrower is 30 years old, single and has no children.  He became involved in the business of electronic games in 2006, opening a game room. Now he has bought several televisions and a generator, in case there is ever a power outage, to expand his business. 
His loans have made a great impact on his social life; his income has risen, and he has a loyal customer base.  His life has completely changed. 
He has been able to save money without difficulty and live normally.  As a young man, he is working hard to achieve his goals of building a house on the family parcel, to get married in the near future, and to find a location to open another game room.

loans.use: two 14 inch color televisions, new games and controllers and a small generator

loans.name: Issa Fary

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un réparateur de véhicule et de vélomoteur. IL a appris ce métier pendant 15 ans auprès de son père qui tenait un atelier dans sa localité.Aujourd'hui, il est à 22 années d'expérience après avoir ouvert son propre atelier.Il vend en même temps des pièces détachées à ses clients. Ces deux activités lui rapportent assez de revenus pour prendre en charge sa famille composée de sa femme et de ses 4 enfants dont les trois vont à l'école. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des pneus d'occasion, des "gentils" et des chambres à air. Son ambition est d'élargir d'avantage ses activités.
texts.en: This borrower is an auto and moped mechanic.  He learned this profession for 15 years alongside his father who had a shop in his town.  Today, he has 22 years of experience after having opened his own shop.  He also sells spare parts to his customers.  These two types of work bring in enough income for him to meet the needs of his family, which includes his wife and four children, three of whom attend school.  In order to build up his working capital, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 f to buy used tires, rims, and inner tubes. His goal is to expand his services.

loans.use: to buy used tires, rims, and inner tubes.

loans.name: Kalumu

texts.en:
Kalumu is a married woman with five children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family income. Kaluma owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kalumu has operated a goat-meat business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est constitué de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 46 ans, 5 enfants et habitant dans la  commune rurale de Sakoïba. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et font le petit commerce de louches, mortiers, calebasses simples et gravées. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata, 2ème femme sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche, est connue pour la vente des calebasses gravées  avec de beaux slogans et figures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3oo calebasses qui seront gravées. 
Pour faire de la gravure, on met des aiguilles dans le feu pendant une heure au moins, quand elles rougissent, on l’enlève puis on fait de beaux dessins avec sur le dos des calebasses. Elle se ravitaille en matières premières à la foire de Katièna. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer et frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four married women, the majority of whom live in polygamous families.  They are on average 46 years old, have 5 children each, and live in the rural commune of Sakoïba.
They met and are united through bonds of kinship, marriage, and are involved in the small business of selling ladles, mortars, and calabash gourds, both simple and engraved.  In order to increase their business, the members of the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and have requested their 12th solidarity loan.  
Aminata, second woman from the right in the photo, is known for the sale of calabash gourds engraved with beautiful motifs and patterns.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 300 calabash gourds which will be engraved.  Engraving is done by dipping needles in the fire for at least an hour.  After the needles have become red, they are removed from the fire and used to make beautiful designs on the back of the gourds.  Aminata buys her raw materials at the Katièna market.  She sells from home, in nearby villages, and at the Grand Market in Ségou, for cash or on credit, to mostly women customers.  With this loan, Aminata expects average monthly profits to reach 25,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the activity and also used to take care of household expenses and children's healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy calabash gourds.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong is 30 year old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Atong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married and has three children ranging from one to 10 years old. She describes herself as a humble and organized woman. For the last four years, she has been selling vegetables and fruits such as oranges, bananas, pumpkins, watermelon, mangoes, onions, potatoes, kale, cabbages etc to local residents. She describes her business challenge to be the high cost of vegetables and fruits. She plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables. In the next five years, Susan's hope is to have diversified her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling fish in Bor South Sudan for two years.
Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 26 years old and married to a business woman. They have two children, age three and five years. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. He has been running a retail store for the last three years. He sells items such as salt, sugar, "blue band," sodas, water, cereal, flour, cooking fat, washing detergent, pain killers, snacks, etc.. His business is located in a busy area. 

He describes his business challenge as insufficient funds to improve his retail shop. He plans to use his Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as flour, salt, sugar, sodas, etc.. In the next five years, Alexander's hope and dream is to run a big supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more home products such as flour, salt, sugar, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is 45 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years. 

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 57-year-old woman who is a mother of five sons and one daughter. Two of her sons are workers with small salaries. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a small salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs and expenses. Fatema wants to help improve the family's income by starting her own project: selling fruits and vegetables to customers and neighbors. Fatema is requesting a $2,000 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing fruits and vegetables to start her project. 

Fatema is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Abdul Rahman appears in her Kiva profile photo.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Aluong

texts.en:
Aluong is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food in Bor South Sudan for two years.

Aluong is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and salt. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 37-year-old man, and a father with three sons and four daughters. He is a bank employee who earns a small salary, but not enough to cover the family's expenses. For the past four years, Hussien has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products. This has been a profitable project.

Hussien is requesting a $2,000 US loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Hussien is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and improve the herd's condition.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Joyce has operated a retail shop for the past five years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to start a cloth-selling business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 29 years old and married with two children, age eight and twelve years. She describes herself as an optimistic woman. For the last two years, Anastacia has been selling vegetables and fruits such as kale, mangos, onions, oranges, etc.. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her store. She will use the Kes 20,000 to buy more vegetables and fruits to resell. In the future, Anastacia hopes and dreams to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for two years.

Achol is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Tatu has operated a fried-fish business for the past six years. Now she wants to start selling fresh fish. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a freezer and more fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anyieth

texts.en:
Anyieth is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for three years.
Anyieth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 31 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have two children, age eight and twelve. He describes himself as an innovative man. He repairs clothes for local residents and walk-in customers. In addition, he sells fabric and clothing. He describes his business challenge as insufficient funds to improve his tailoring services. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fabric to make clothes for resale. In the future, Joshua looks forward to running several similar retail stores.

loans.use: to buy more material to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a divorced woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house with running water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a fruit (cassava, mangos and coconuts) stand for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more cassava, mangos and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava, mangos and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en:
Alek is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for three years.
Alek is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 49 years old and married with four children. She runs a pub to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy beer and to furnish her room.

loans.use: To buy beer and to furnish her room.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. One is still too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Nuru has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale and build a shade for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale and build a shade for her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 39 years old and married with four children. He farms to earn a living and has been in the business for eight years. He has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business. He has applied for 48,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De San Juan Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES DE SAN JUAN
Integrada por doña Mónica, de 29 años casada y madre de 2 niños de 10 y 6 años de edad, doña Mónica tiene una venta de variedades como repuestos para licuadoras, cargadores de teléfono, herramientas mecánicas, radios,  licuadoras de segunda mano, ella logra adquirir estos productos por medio de su esposo quien trabaja como electromecánico dentro de su comunidad, quien la  apoya grandemente en su pequeño negocio ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de repuestos para la repararacion de electrodomesticos como licuadoras cargadores de telefonos etc, , doña Thelma Judith, de 22 años de edad y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad viajan diariamente hacia el mercado dela terminal donde ella vende verdura peladas y preparadas para  (Sopas, guisados, ensaladas, etc.) doña Thelma ha seguido el negocio que su madre inicio hace varios años, ahora ella necesita demás  capital para invertir y  aprovechar la  temporada navideña e incluir en su venta hojas  de sal las cuales son las mas utilizadas en Guatemala para la elaboración de tamales. Aunque ambos negocios sean diferentes ellas saben que gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo del crédito pueden ser de gran ayuda para ella y a sus esposos, como tambien a la sociedad con su servicio.
texts.en:
The "Duo Mujeres de San Juan" group is made up of Mónica and Thelma Judith. Mónica is 29, married, and the mother of two children, ages 10 and 6. Monica sells a variety of items, such as replacement parts for blenders, phone chargers, mechanic's tools, radios, and second-hand blenders. She manages to obtain these products through her husband, who works as an electrical technician in his community, and is a great help to her in her small business.

She is applying to us for this loan to buy replacement parts for appliances such as blenders, as well as phone chargers etc. 

Thelma Judith, 22, and her small 4-year-old child travel daily to the market at the bus terminal, where she sells peeled and prepared vegetables for soups, stews, salads, etc. Thelma has continued the business that her mother started several years ago. 

Now she needs more working capital to take advantage of the Christmas season and sell hojas de sal (maxán leaves) which are the most used for making tamales in Guatemala.

Although both businesses are different, they know that thanks to their efforts, and the loan support, they can really help themselves and their husbands, as well as society with their work.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for home appliances such as blenders, as well as radios, and phone chargers.

loans.name: Dinora Urbina

texts.es:
La señora Dinora tiene 44 años de edad, es viuda con dos hijos, su esposo falleció hace ocho años. Desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas, fue su esposo quien le enseño, pues ella quería ayudarle para que su familia tuviera algo en la vida, ahora que ha quedado sola es la encargada de llevar el sustento a sus hijos.

Dinora se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ordeñar una vaca que tiene, luego la lleva al terreno en donde se queda trabajando ahí durante seis horas, para llegar a ese lugar camina durante cuarenta y cinco minutos por unos callejones, luego vuelve a su casa a preparar el almuerzo. Los insumos agrícolas los compra en un pueblo, para llegar ahí ella camina a pie por unos callejones por treinta minutos, después aborda un pick up que se tarda noventa minutos en llegar al pueblo.

La señora solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar tres terneros de repasto, ya que de la cosecha que saco, le quedo rastrojo para el ganado. Así ella tendrá sus animales, los cuales podrá vender más adelante y al mismo tiempo que aprovechara el rastrojo que le quedo de sus cosechas. El propósito de Dinora es trabajar muy fuerte, para construirles a sus hijos una casa de ladrillo, ya que en la que viven actualmente es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Sra. Dinora is 44 and a widow with two children. Her husband died eight years ago. She has been a farmer for the past 20 years and was taught by her husband. She wanted to help him so that the family would have something in life. Now that she is alone, she is responsible for supporting her children.

Dinora gets up at 4 a.m. to milk a cow she has. Then she takes it to the land where she remains working for six hours. In order to arrive at her plot she walks for 45 minutes along some lanes. Then she returns to her house to prepare lunch. She buys agricultural supplies in a village, which takes her a thirty minute walk Then she takes a pick-up back home, which takes another ninety minutes.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo to purchase three calves to fatten since after the harvest there is stubble for the cattle. Thus she will have her animals that she will be able to sell later while making good use of the husks that are left behind after the harvest. Dinora’s goal is to work very hard so she can build a brick house for her children since the one they currently live in is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy three calves to graze.

loans.name: Mwadiga

texts.en:
Mwadiga is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this 100,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar, soaps and detergents for resale. In the future, Mwadiga aspires to continue improving his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Mwadiga has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and he thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar, soaps and detergents for resale

loans.name: Mamadchon

texts.ru: Мамадчон женат и любящий отец троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 12 лет он занимается купле продажей сантехнических принадлежностей. Имеет широкий ассортимент ванн, умывальников и  других  сантехнических принадлежностей. Мамадчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для пополнения оборотных средств. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mamadchon is married and a loving father of three children. His wife takes care of the household. For over 12 years, Mamadchon has been selling plumbing supplies. He has a wide assortment of bathtubs, sinks and other plumbing items. Mamadchon would like to expand his business and earn a good profit. He would like to obtain a loan of 10000 somoni in order to replenish his working capital. He is hoping for your help and goodwill.

loans.use: to replenish his working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old and married with one child, aged 8. She sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for 12 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sack of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy a sack of charcoal

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres.

Ella se dedica desde hace más de un año a la compra y venta de mercadería, como granos básicos y golosinas, esta idea surgió debido a la motivación, deseo de superación y al apoyo de su mamá. La mercadería la compra en el mercado de una ciudad del oriente del país y el resto se la llegan a dejar a su casa los proveedores.

Ella no posee crédito de ningún tipo, el crédito que solicita lo hace como una alternativa de superación personal, ya que quiere instalar una tienda más fuerte en el mercado municipal. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más variedad de mercadería, lo que le permitirá vender aún más y mejorar su calidad de vida al tener mayor poder adquisitivo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 24 years old. She is the single mother of a 5 year old son and she lives in her parents' house. 

She has been buying and selling merchandise for more than a year, such as basic grains and sweets. This idea came about due to the motivation, desire to succeed, and the support of her mother. She buys the merchandise in the market of a city which is east of the country and the rest the suppliers leave at her house. 

She does not have loans of any kind. The loan that she is asking for is as an option to personal triumph, as she wants to set up a stronger store in the town market. The loan that she is asking for is to buy a greater variety of merchandise which will permit her to sell even more and improve her quality of life to have more purchasing power.

loans.use: to buy more variety of merchandise in order to sell more in the store

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be a patient man. He operates a retail store where he provides services of repairing clothes and selling new clothes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a viable and strategic area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing. James's business goal is to run a venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to sew clothes for selling

loans.name: Gricelda Cristina

texts.es:
Gricelda tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad, vive con su mamá y dos hermanos. 

Hace cinco meses ella inicio con la instalación de una tienda de productos básicos, lo hizo debido a la necesidad que tiene de generar ingresos para sobrevivir junto con su hija. La mercadería la compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, ya que la adquiere a precios más bajos. 

 El préstamo que esta solicitando Gricelda es para comprar más cantidad y con más variedad de mercadería. Su objetivo es surtir la tienda para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo generar mayores ingresos para su familia, tener una estabilidad económica y fortalecimiento de su negocio. Ella continuara trabajando muy fuerte para tener una tienda surtida.
texts.en:
Gricelda is 19 years old. She is the single mother of a 2 year old child. She lives with her mother and her two siblings.

Five months ago she began setting up a general store. She did it because of the necessity of being able to earn income in order to survive together with her daughter. She buys the merchandise in a city in the eastern part of the country, as she is able to get lower prices.

The loan that Gricelda is asking for is to buy greater quantity and more variety of merchandise. Her objective is to supply the store in order to meet the demand of her clients and at the same time to generate better income for her family, while having economic stability and strengthening her business. She will continue working very hard in order to have a diverse store.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and more variety of merchandise

loans.name: Maritazari

texts.en: Maritazari is a 41-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a produce store that he started 5 years back. He started with capital worth 800,000 but now it is worth 5 million. In spite of his progress, he faces the challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and the poor roads where he buys his produce. His dream is to educate his children and expand his store in Kamwenge. Maritazari needs the loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling

loans.name: Darius

texts.en: Darius is a hardworking married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he started last year. He started with capital worth 400,000 but now it is worth 2 million. Despite his progress, Darius faces the challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. His dreams are educating his children and expanding his business into new markets. He needs the loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 27-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a motorcyclist for the last three years and he has been renting other people's motorcycles and paying a big percentage to the owners. His dreams are to buy his own motorcycle, educate his children and build a permanent home. Richard needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es:
Guillermo es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza todos los días para sacar a su hogar adelante.
Guillermo, con 60 años de edad se encuentra casado, y todos los días se esfuerza en su trabajo con el ánimo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y el. 
Guillermo gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Guillermo, cuenta con un gran cultivo de legumbres, las cuales son reconocidas por ser de muy buena calidad. Guillermo tiene un pedido de un cliente que le compra a muy buen precio, por lo que quiere sacar adelante su producción.
Debido a situaciones adversas como el clima, Guillermo debe regar abono a su cultivo, de modo que pueda seguir creciendo para poderlo vender, sin embargo, Guillermo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar el abono, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de abono para su cultivo y nuevas semillas para sembrar. 
Guillermo espera que su negocio le siga generando buenos ingresos, para poder así seguir sosteniendo los gastos de su hogar. 

Guillermo sueña con que su negocio crezca, y su cultivo sea más reconocido. Además, sueña con brindar oportunidad de empleo a las personas del sector para que progresen económicamente.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a hard working person that tries to get ahead every day.

Guillermo is 60 years old, married, and every day works hard with the aim of improving the quality of life for his wife and himself.

Guillermo has devoted much of his life to the activity of agriculture, and thanks to this he has generated the necessary income to maintain his home.

Guillermo has a large crop of vegetables which are known for their good quality. Guillermo has an order from a client to buy at a very good price which is why he wants to go ahead with his production.

Due to adverse conditions such as weather, Guillermo needs to scatter fertilizer on his crop so that he can continue growing in order to be able to sell it, but Guillermo does not have the necessary funds in order to buy the fertilizer which is why he is hoping for a loan to provide the possibility of being able to buy the fertilizer for his crops and new seeds to plant.

Guillermo hopes that his business continues generating good earnings in order to continue sustaining his household expenses.

Guillermo’s dream is that his business grows, and his crops become more known. Furthermore, his dream is to give the opportunity of employment to people in the area in order that they might progress economically.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop and new seeds to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, milk products, and candies to increase her sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 55-year-old married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop that she started 7 years back.  She started with capital worth 800,000 UGX and made profits, from which she has managed to buy a new motorcycle.  In spite of her progress, Rose is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time.  Her dream is educating her children, building a permanent home and moving her business to a more permanent location. Rose needs this loan to buy rice, sugar and salt for resale

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and salt

loans.name: Fanis

texts.en:
Fanis is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a persistent woman. She operates a retail store where she provides services repairing clothes and selling new clothes that she makes.  

Fanis has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a less competitive area and her primary customers are local residents and walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her retail store. 

Fanis will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing. Her business goal is to run another similar retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay school fees

loans.name: José Elias

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es casado con un bebe de ocho meses de edad. Él se dedica a la crianza de ganado pecuario y a la siembra granos básicos como maíz y maicillo, en la temporada agrícola, su esposa le ayuda. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos siempre han realizado estas actividades su mamá a la crianza de ganado y su papá a la siembra de granos básicos. 

Los semovientes los compra en los tiangues de la ciudad, que se encuentran a cinco kilómetros desde su casa y cuando hay alguien que venda cerca le avisan para que él los vaya a negociar. Para llegar al tiangue aborda un microbús que se demora en promedio de diez a quince minutos.

El préstamo que solicita José es para comprar dos semovientes para la crianza. De esta forma incrementara la cantidad de ganado y llegara a seis con las dos vaquillas que comprara porque serán de ordeño para la producción de leche y cubrir la demanda existente, lo que le ayudara a recibir más ingresos para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is married and has an 8-month-old baby. His work is raising cattle and planting basic grains such as corn and maicillo (similar to millet). His wife helps him during the growing season. He learned this work from his parents, since they always carried out these activities. His mother raised livestock and his father planted basic grains.

He buys his animals in the markets in the city, which are located five kilometers from his house, and when there is someone who is selling nearby, they notify him so that he can come to negotiate. He travels to the market by microbus, which takes, on average, 10 to 15 minutes.

The loan that José is applying for is to buy two cattle to raise. In this way he will increase the number of cattle he has, and he will have six with the two small cows that he will buy. They will be milked to supply milk to meet the existing demand, which will help him to receive more income to invest in the purchase of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy two cows to raise

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

Haron operates a farm where he sells maize.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members.  His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his farm business. 

Haron will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.  His business goal is to expand his business and employ more people in the next 5 years.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a fifty-eight-year-old married man with thirteen children living in Kasese, Uganda.  His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.  He has been in cotton farming for the last ten years.  After starting the business with a capital of one million UGX, it has grown to three million.  His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Moses wants a loan to buy cotton to sell.

loans.use: buy cotton

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old.  He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en:
To raise the family, Mrs. Yonn, a widowed woman, runs a micro-business at home. Besides rice husbandry, she grows vegetables for sale and raises some poultry, from which she is able to earn approximately $2.00 per day. She has been blessed with two children, all of whom presently are already married. And one among them lives together with Yonn in order to help her manage the businesses.

Yonn now would like to borrow some funds from HKL to start growing her dry-season rice in a new cycle. She will use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. Yonn is very hopeful in life and business, although she is now 50 years old.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo above is Hawanatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Makeni, Hawanatu is age 48. She is married and has five children—two in college and three in secondary school. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials, like iron, corrugated zinc, and cement for the construction of a house. At the end of each month, Hawanatu will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, and cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 32-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 4 years old. She describes herself as determined and focused. 

Roselyne operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 months. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are retail shoppers.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from the customers. 

Roselyne will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell.  Her business goal is to own two boutiques and be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo above is Mabel, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Gbonkolenken Yeleh, in northern Sierra Leone, Mabel is age 47. She is married, and the couple has four children together—one in primary school and three in secondary school.  Mabel has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc., for the construction of a house. At the end of each month, Mabel will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Maurice S.

texts.en: Pictured above is Maurice, a secondary school teacher in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. Forty years old, Maurice was born in Makeni. A husband, and a father of seven children, Maurice has served in the teaching profession for 33 years now. His wife is a housewife. Some of his children are in college, and others are no longer attending school. Maurice has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mr. Un is 51 years old and a resident of Baray District. He has a life partner in his wife, who is 49, and has been blessed with four children: one is married and three are single. Un cultivates rice crops twice a year to generate his income and takes some time to go fishing along the Tonle Sap River. His wife sells the fish he caught to local villagers and raises some piglets at home.

Un is taking out his second loan from Kiva to purchase rice seeds for five hectares of farmland and 10 bags of fertilizer. In the future, Un hopes to improve his family-owned businesses and generate additional household income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for five hectares of farmland and 10 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Onoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Onoria tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida  y dos hijos.  La hija que esta pequeña asiste a la escuela, el hijo mayor no estudia porque no alcanzan con los gastos de los dos, por lo que el hijo mayor trabaja en la agricultura para cubrir sus gastos personales. Ella trabaja como cocinera en un negocio de venta de comida desde hace cinco años. Para llegar a su trabajo se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para abordar un autobús a las 5:30 a.m. que recorre unos cinco kilómetros. Lo primero que hace al llegar a su trabajo es poner a descongelar toda la comida que se cocinara ese día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que esta recién construida y le hace falta repellar las paredes y otros detalles para dejarla más amena. Lo primordial para Onoria es tener un techo confortable para su familia, un espacio solo para ellos, ya que siempre ha vivido con más personas. Además su vivienda será un patrimonio para sus hijos y hace que se sienta orgullosa de ser una mujer emprendedora y digna de su trabajo. Mas adelante piensa solicitar otro financiamiento para ponerle el piso a la casa, ella desea que su hija continué estudiando, y brindarle el estudio al hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Onoria is 37 years old. She lives with her life partner and two children. Her daughter, who is little, attends school. Her older son does not go to school because they can't manage the expenses for both, so her older son works in agriculture to pay for his personal expenses. She has been working for five years as a cook in a business that sells food. To get to her work, she gets up at 4:30 a.m. to take a bus at 5:30 to go about five kilometers. The first thing she does when she arrives at her work is take out all the food that will be cooked that day to thaw. 

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in improving her house, since it was recently constructed and the walls need to be plastered, and other details to make it more pleasant. The primary goal for Onoria is to have a comfortable home for her family, a space only for them, since she has always lived with more people. In addition, their house will be an inheritance for her children and it makes her proud to be an entrepreneurial woman who is worthy of her work. In the future, she is thinking of applying for another loan to install a floor in the house. She wants her daughter to continue going to school and to offer schooling to her older son.

loans.use: to improve her house, since it was recently constructed and the walls need to be plastered and other details to make it more pleasant

loans.name: Duo Danny's Group

texts.es:
DUO DANNY'S
Integrada por  la señora Lucia de 51 años de edad, doña Lucia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, desde hace 10 años, inicialmente vendía refacciones para los niños que pasaban hacia la escuela de la  su localidad, y al darse cuenta que a los alrededores no había una venta de tortilla  se motivo gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de una muchacha que laboraba con ella adicionalmente, y tambien ahora ella vende ropa típica en la ciudad capital  únicamente los días domingos,y por lo nismo esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mais por mayo y compra de mercaderia para la venta de ropa tipica, como comerciante conoció a la señorita María Eugenia, de 19 años,  quien desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carnitas y chicharrones, a un costado de la venta de tortillas de doña Lucia, Eugenia cuenta que el negocio que atiende fue gracias a la iniciativa de su mama, rentando un local y darse a conocer en su comunidad por la rico y sabrosa preparación de sus carnitas y chicharrones, ahora cuentan con dos chicharronerias en la ciudad capital.
Doña Lucia necesita de capital para poder invertir un poco mas en la venta de tortillas y  de ropa típica por la temporada de navidad, y año nuevo, como también Eugenia tiene gracias a Dios varios pedidos de carne para convivios navideños, por lo que deciden trabajar juntas como compañeras de crédito y mujeres exitosas.
texts.en:
The "Duo Danny's" group is made up of Lucia who is 51, and Maria Eugenia who is 19. 

Lucia has been making and selling tortillas from her home for ten years. At first she sold snacks to children who passed by on their way to the local school. When she realized that there was no place selling tortillas in the surrounding area, she started one, thanks to the support she got from a girl who worked with her as a helper. 

She now also sells traditional clothing in the capital city, but only on Sundays. So she is applying for this loan to buy corn at wholesale, and merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing. 

As a small business owner, she got to know Maria Eugenia, who for three years has been making and selling carnitas and chicharrones (barbecued pork and pork rinds) beside Lucia's tortilla stand. 

Eugenia has the business she runs thanks to her mother's initiative in renting a place, and in making a name for herself in her community for the rich, delicious way she makes her carnitas and chicharrones. Now they have two chicharrones stands in the capital city. 

Lucia needs working capital to be able to invest a bit more in her tortilla and traditional clothing businesses for the Christmas and New Year's season. 

Fortunately, Eugenia also had several meat orders for Christmas gatherings, so they are deciding to work together as loan partners and successful women.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas, and merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing.

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.ru: Чаббор трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Чтобы содержать свою семью он начал занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции более 10 лет. За эти многие годы он изучал, все стороны бизнеса и сейчас с легкостью справляется с этим бизнесом. Чаббор запрашивает займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Jabbor is a hardworking and honest person. He's married and is the father of four children. In order to provide for his family he started up farming about ten years ago. By this day, he's analyzed all aspects of this business and is now now easily capable to succeed within it. 
Jabbor is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. He's hoping for your kindness and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shamil

texts.ru: Шамил добрый и трудолюбивый молодой парень. Он хотел стать самостоятельным и более 5 лет он заниматься выращиванием сельхозпродукций. На приусадебном участке он выращивает лук, картофель, помидоры, чеснок и болгарский перец. Затем после сбора урожая он продает сельхозпродукцию на рынке. В бизнесе помогают родители. Шамил хотел бы получить займ для покупки горюче-смазочных материалов и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Shamil is a kind and hardworking young man. His goal was to become self-dependent; five years ago he became working as a farmer. He grows onions, potatoes, garlic and Bulgarian peppers on a plot of land. After harvesting his crops he sells them at a local market. His parents help the business. 

Shamil is asking for a loan in order to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rahmidin

texts.ru: Рахмидин трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Он очень целеустремленный и старается расширить свой бизнес, получить хорошую прибыль. Более 5 лет он занимается выращиванием лука и пшеницы. Имеет землю и на 60 соток земли сеет лук и на 100 соток выращивает пшеницу. Все члены семьи, помогают ему по бизнесу. Полученный урожай продает на местном рынке. Рахмидин хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений для выращивания пшеницы и лука.
texts.en:
Rahmidin is an honest and diligent family man. He's very dedicated and wishes to expand his business and increase his profits. For over five years he's grown wheat and onions. Rahmidin owns land: six hectares are delegated to growing onions and ten hectares to wheat. Every member of his family pitches in and helps the business. The grown produce is sold at a local market. 

Rahmidin is asking for a loan in order to purchase some mineral fertilizers which would assist him in growing his crops.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yanira tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 17, 13 y 7 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica al comercio de pupusas los días sábados y domingos y durante la semana se dedica a vender platos típicos como enchiladas, pasteles de carne, yuca frita y salcochada y refrescos naturales.

Esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá, por que ella se ha dedicado a la venta de pupusas y también la iniciativa surgió de algunas vecinas que la motivaron a que ella instalara el negocio en su casa, ya que cerca de ahí no hay otros negocios de comida. También su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. Los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de las pupusas y de los platos típicos los compra en el mercado de la ciudad transportándose en un microbús que tarda diez minutos aproximadamente y en algunas tiendas que se encuentran a cinco kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de un quintal de maíz, seis repollos, media caja de tomates para elaborar la salsa, aceite, condimentos, entre otros. También lo utilizara para comprar media camionada de arena, 500 ladrillos, 15 bolsas de cemento y 5 quintales de hierro para construir una habitación a su casa.

Con la inversión Yanira contara con los materiales suficientes para elaborar las pupusas y los platos típicos, de manera que cubrirá la demanda existente y le permitirá obtener ganancias para construir una habitación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yanira is 33 years old, is married, and has three children, ages 17, 13, and 7.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells pupusas [stuffed corn cakes], and during the week she sells traditional dishes such as enchiladas, meat pies, fried cassava, and boiled cassava, along with fruit juice.

Yanira learned this activity from her mother, who has made a living selling pupusas.  The initiative for her business came in part from some neighbors, who motivated her to set up the business in her house, since there were no other food businesses nearby.  Yanira’s husband also helps her with the business.  She purchases the ingredients she needs for making pupusas and traditional dishes in the city market, which takes her about ten minutes to get to by minibus, and in some shops that are located about five kilometers from her house. 

Yanira is asking for the loan so she can purchase 46 kg (100 lbs) of maize, six cabbages, half a box of tomatoes for making sauce, oil, seasoning, and other items.  She will also use the loan to purchase half a truckload of sand, 500 bricks, 15 bags of cement, and 230 kg (500 lbs) of rebar, which she will use to build a room in her house.

The loan will ensure that Yanira will have enough ingredients for making pupusas and other traditional dishes to meet existing demand.  It will also allow her to earn enough profits to build a room for her children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making pupusas and other traditional dishes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Elena has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Makhkamoi

texts.ru: Махкамой трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Более 3-х лет она занимается купле продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она покупает скот на рынке, а затем  откармливает до набора определенного  веса, потом продает на рынке за хорошую цену. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Makhhamoi is a hard-working and goal-oriented woman. For over three years, she has been reselling cattle. She buys farm animals at a market, fattens them until the reach a certain weight, and eventually resells at the market at a good price. She would like to receive a loan in the amount of 10,000 TJS to purchase cattle and sheep in order to bolster her working capital. She is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Betty has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Evelyn has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy fish for sale.
Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is a local farmer from the Prey Chor district who has been living and operating her business there for ages. She grows rice two times a year, both in the rainy and dry seasons. She always has her husband help manage the farming activities. Presently, she is 47 years old and has four children. 
Sok has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to fill the lowest part of the house with soil in order to avoid suffering from water in the rainy season. With the balance of the loan, she will pay for the process of growing her dry-season rice this year. Sok wishes to increase her rice output throughout the year and provide her children with further education, high school level at a minimum.

loans.use: to fill the lowest part of the house with soil in order to avoid suffering from water in the rainy season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Beatriz has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Beatriz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Beatriz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 31 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos, viven en casa propia. La actividad principal es la pesca artesanal a la cual se dedica su esposo y ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace cinco años. Oficio que aprendió por la necesidad de superación de si misma y también de mejorar los ingresos de su familia.

Para elaborar las tortillas, utiliza maíz, cal, leña para estos insumos ya tienen un proveedor y su esposo le ayuda con la madera y parte del mercado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar redes para pescar, ya que las que están utilizando no sirven y no pueden realizar la actividad bien.  En un futuro desea solicitar otro financiamiento para almacenar maíz y tener para cuando este más caro y no tener que comprarlo a más alto precio ahorrar ese dinero para mejorar sus  ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 31, married, and has two children. They live in their own home. Their main livelihood is traditional fishing, which her husband does. She has been making and selling tortillas for five years, a trade that she learned through the necessity of bettering herself, and also improving her family's income. 

To make the tortillas, she uses corn, lime, and firewood. She already has a supplier for the ingedients, and her husband helps her with the wood, and part of the selling. 

The loan for which she is applying to Fundación Campo is to buy fishing nets, as the ones they are using don't work, and they can't do their work well. 

In the future she wishes to apply for another loan to stockpile corn, and have it for when it is more expensive, and not have to buy it at a higher price. This way she can save that money to improve their income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Reynelda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Reynelda continua con su negocio, una pulperia, que tiene muy surtida, y esta a cargo de un cafetin, en donde su esposo a tiende el cafetin, oh la pulperia, ambos trabajan para el bienestar de su familia, sus tres hijos estudian, y los gastos son altos.
Atraves de los financiamientos, logro aumentar las ventas, el inventario, obteniendo ventas altas, lo que ha logrado invertir en mas productos demandado por los clientes, dar a sus hijos lo necesario, pagar sus gastos basicos, y gastos personales.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara. Granos basicos, carne, pollo, huevo, queso, chorizos, mortadela, pan, gaseosas, jugos, agua purificada, eskimo, y productos escolares, ya que ah ambos negocios tiene que surtirlo, y manteniendo a su clientela sastifecha.
texts.en:
Reynelda still has her general store business, that she has well-stocked.  She also runs a small café, and her husband looks after the café or the general store. Both are working for their family's well-being. Their three children are in school, and the expenses are high. 

Through the loans, they have succeeded in increasing  their sales and inventory, obtaining good sales, So they have managed to invest in more products that their customers ask for, provide their children with the necessities, and pay for their basic costs and personal expenses. 

With this new loan she will buy staple grains, meat, chicken, eggs, cheese, sausages, mortadella, bread, soft drinks, juices, purified water, ice cream, and school supplies. This is because they have to supply both businesses and keep their customers satisfied.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, meat, chicken, dairy products, soft drinks, candy, and other products that are in demand.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Ines emprendedora, mujer humilde, trabajadora, comerciante de abarrotes y más, con el apoyo de la financiera ha logrado aumentar su producto en variedad e ingreso de nuevos productos. Sus planes es ampliar el local, ir mejorando su nivel de vida, la infraestructura de su casa para beneficio de sus hijos. 
Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprara mercadería como: cosméticos, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas de cuerpo, tratamientos de cabellos, granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, lácteos, embutidos, verduras, cereales, avena, pinolillo, gaseosas, jugos, enlatados, leche en polvo, galletas, golosinas, bisuterías, papel higiénico, jabones, sopas maggi, maruchanes entre otros productos que a diarios vende en su pulpería abasteciendo a los hogares de su alrededor de víveres.
Agradece a la financiera por el continuo apoyo al desarrollo del negocio y al mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ines is an enterprising, modest, hard-working woman who has a small business selling groceries and other products. With the help of the loan, she has succeeded in increasing the variety of her produce, and in bringing in new products.  

Her plan is to expand her shop, gradually improving her standard of living, and her housing conditions for her children's benefit. With this new loan she will buy merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants, body creams, hair treatments, staple grains, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oils, dairy products, cold cuts, vegetables, cereals, oatmeal, soft drinks, juices, canned goods, powdered milk, cookies, candy, costume jewelry, toilet paper, soaps, maggi and maruchan soups, and other products that she sells every day in her small general store, supplying the homes in the surrounding area with food products. 

She is grateful to the institution for their continued support in the development of her business, and the improvement of her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for daily household use.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Саъдулло трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Он занимается купле- продажей мелкого рогатого скота.  Он начал свой бизнес с 2000 Сомони в 2002 году. Данное время имеет 3 голов крупного и 25 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Среди населения кишлака он имеет хорошую репутацию. Саъдулло продает скот из своего дома и иногда ездит на рынок. Саъдулло хотел бы получить займ  для покупки мелкого рогатого скота.
texts.en: Sadullo is a hardworking and responsible family man. He does resale of small horned cattle. He started his business with 2,000 somoni in 2002. At this time he has three heads of large and 25 heads of small horned cattle. He has a good reputation among the village residents. Sadullo sells the livestock from his home and sometimes goes on the market. Sadullo wants to get a loan to buy small horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is fifty-three years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Cristita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cristita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cristita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is fifty-three years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Fely has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy Natasha and Avon to sell. 

Fely has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy Natasha and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is thirty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Riza has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon to sell. 

Riza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Riza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Eney

texts.en:
Eney is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Eney has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Eney has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Eney hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en: At this time, he wants to purchase 4 more milk cows from herders to increase the output of his business. It costs over 4,000,000 MNT and his sales volume will be expanded when he has 4 more cows as he plans. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of 4 more cows to expand his business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of 4 more cows to expand his business

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhin is a 39-year-old married woman who has been residing in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. To generate her income, Chhin is in two businesses: rice husbandry and making handmade baskets. These two businesses only provide her family with enough daily food. However, the main income is from her husband, who is in an animal-trading business. Chhin has three single children: the oldest one works as a construction worker and the other two are still students.

With the loan requested from HKL, Chhin will use it to buy a couple of cows for farming purpose. She hopes to improve her business through using a Kiva loan and anticipates having a proper house someday.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows for farming purposes

loans.name: Ankhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ankhbaatar, 41, runs a passenger transportation business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since last year he has been running his business and he has already had many customers and gained enough experience in it. He lives with his wife and his 2 kids in an old wooden house which is in the slum district of the city.

Ankhbaatar needed a loan to renovate his old house in these coming months. The house was built in the early 1980s and has never been renovated since. The walls, roof and floor need to be insulated and the plumbing system needs to be replaced.

After renovations, the house should become well insulated from the cold weather, and coal usage and emission of smoke will be much reduced. At the same time, it will reduce air pollution around the city. Therefore, a loan will be dedicated to purchase the necessary building materials such as bricks, pipes, wood planks, paints and some insulation materials for his house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials such as bricks, pipes, wood planks, paints and some insulation materials for his house renovation

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga, 25, is a taxi driver around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for 2 years and before he used to work as a driver. He lives with his family in the slum district of the city. His daily income is about 20 bucks and it is a main income source for his family currently.

Now Gantulga needed some money to repair some of its damages and change old spare parts. It is an important thing to his service quality and customers' satisfaction. Also he hopes that the number of his daily service turns will be raised after the renovation. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the necessary spare parts for his taxi car repair.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary spare parts for his taxi car repair

loans.name: Naranjargal

texts.en:
Naranjargal is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in a common apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She runs a clothes tailoring shop close to her home. Initially, she started her business alone 2 years ago. Currently, 3 sewers work in her tailoring shop with 5 old sewing machines. 

In a month there will be the Lunar Year, which is a Mongolian traditional respectful celebration, and traditional cloth orders (called “deel”) will be increased notably during those days. Therefore, Naranjargal wants to prepare her raw materials early for the celebration. It is a big chance to take so many orders.
