loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and over-sewing machine as well as materials for the sewing activity

loans.name: Makhare

texts.en:
Makhare is from Terjola District, West Georgia. He is 23 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents. Makhare works as an operator at a local petrol station. He is also actively involved in the family agricultural business, led by his parents. 

The family owns two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell on average 40 kg of it to local dairy-products retailers. Also, the family has two small greenhouses, where greens (in winter months) and cucumbers and tomatoes (in summer months) are grown. They sell harvested products locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Makhare requested credit for purchasing a tractor. He will provide tilling and other agricultural services to the farms located in his and nearby villages. It will significantly increase the income of the family. They will be able to purchase additional household goods in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor to provide seasonal services to farmers.

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en:
Mathews is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

He operates a retail business where he sells metal tools. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a highly populated and strategic area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more metal tools. Mathews's business goal is to run a well-equipped blacksmith shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more metal.

loans.name: Ever Andres

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor manera en que se puede describir a Ever Andres, un joven de 20 años que siempre ha querido generar sus propios ingresos y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Ever Andres se dedica a la preparación de comidas rápidas en un carro de comidas rápidas y esta ubicado en el parque principal de su municipio, gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus padres. Ever Andres actualmente trabaja en un carro de comidas rápidas que es alquilado, por lo que debe pagar arriendo cada vez que lo utiliza. Con el ánimo de cambiar esta situación, Ever Andres ha ahorrado dinero para comprarse un carro de comidas rápidas, sin embargo, aún no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar su carro de comidas rápidas. Es por esto que acude a un préstamo con el ánimo de poder comprar un carro de comidas rápidas y no tener que pagar el arrendamiento por la utilización del que tiene.

Ever Andres espera que de esta manera puedan aumentar sus ingresos ya que no tendrá que pagarle a nadie el arrendamiento por usar su carro de comidas rápidas. Sueña con que su negocio se convierta en un gran puesto de comidas que sea reconocido y pueda generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Entrepreneur is the best word to describe Ever Andres - a young man of 20 years of age - who has always wanted to earn his own income and to contribute to the household expenses. Ever Andres prepares fast food for a living, in a fast food cart which is located in the main park in his area. Thanks to this job he earns enough money to pay the bills in the house in which he lives with his parents. Ever Andres currently works at a rented fast food cart and he therefore has to pay rent each time he uses it. With the intention of changing this situation, Ever Andres has saved some money to buy a fast food cart. However, he still does not have enough money to buy it. It is with the intention of being able to buy a fast food cart and not having to pay rent for the use of one, that he has applied for a loan.

Ever Andres hopes that this will help him increase his income since he will not have to pay rent to anyone for use of their fast food cart. He hopes that his business will become a big food stall that is recognized and that it will generate employment for people who need it most.

loans.use: to purchase a fast food cart and therefore not have to pay rent for the use of one.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui vit avec son épouse et ses trois enfants.Il pratique l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine. Il s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdommadaire de l'intérieur du pays en boeufs qu'il engraisse et revend sur le marché local.Il prend en charge les dépenses d'alimentation, d'habillement, de santé ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 500000f afin d'acheter quatre bœufs. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who lives with his wife and his three children. He is a cattle farmer and specialises in fattening cattle. He buys his cattle stock at the weekly inland markets and sells them at the local market. He pays for the food, clothing, health, and schooling costs for his children. To increase his activity, he requests a loan of 500000 Fr to purchase four bullocks. His ambition is to develop his business.

loans.use: purchase four steers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 15 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be a focused and aggressive man. 

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a fast-growing urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the butcher shop. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more meat for selling. Patrick's business goal is to run another similar butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more meat for selling.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es: Sherly, de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 6 años. Ambos esperan la llegada de su próximo hijo quien tiene 8 meses en la barriguita de su mamá. Y juntos vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pilcomayo. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar por si sola. Pues su lema es “progresar”.  Su principal actividad es la venta de comida, en sus inicios tenía un restaurante donde vendía comida casera. Con el tiempo adquirió un lugar más atractivo, pues se ubicaba en una zona céntrica; ahí comenzó a vender tamales, café, jugos y bebidas diversas y pequeños aperitivos. Ella trabaja sin descanso de lunes a domingo sin parar, ya que de esa manera obtendrá buenos resultados. A la par con su crecimiento, afrontó un nuevo reto, se casó y conformó una familia, la que ahora se fortaleza con la llegado de su primer hijo. Luis, aparte de ser un esposo ejemplar es un policía responsable que vela por el bienestar de la sociedad. Su objetivo ahora, es invertir en su restaurante y hacerlo conocido. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Sherly de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos para preparar la rica comida que solo ella sabe hacer.
texts.en:
Sherly is 27 years old and is a hardworking woman. She lives with Luis, her husband of 8 years. They are expecting their first child who has been in mommy's tummy for the past 8 months. They live together in their own house which is located in the town of Pilcomayo. Since she was young she has worked for herself. Her motto is "progress". Her main job is selling food. She started off with a restaurant where she sold homemade food. In time, she attained a more attractive premises and now she is located in a central area. There she began to sell tamales, coffee, juice and different drinks and small snacks.

She works without a break from Monday to Sunday because this gets her good results. Along with her development, she faced faced a new challenge - she got married and started a family, which is now becoming stronger with the arrival of her first child. Luis, apart from being a model husband, is also a responsible police officer who protects the well-being of society. 

Now her objective is to invest in her restaurant and make it well-known. She belongs to the support group "Los Emprendedores" [The Entrepreneurs] and this is the fifth loan with MFP and she hopes that this small loan will help her to fulfill her goals. Apart from that she promises to make her repayments, as she did in previous loans. Furthermore, she is pleased to be part of her association because all the members are responsible and supportive. On receiving her loan, Sherly will invest the money requested in the purchase of supplies to prepare the delicious food that only she knows how to make.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Fatimata est une femme qui vit seule avec ses deux enfants depuis le décès de son mari.Elle a ouvert un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires dont les revenus lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l'huile et des produits divers. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: Fatimata is a woman who lives alone with her two children since her husband passed away. She opened a grocery shop from which the proceeds enable her to provide for herself and her family. In order to build up her business, she requests a loan of 100000 f to buy sacks of rice, oil and various products. Her ambition is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice,oil and various products.

loans.name: Gona

texts.en:
Gona is a 30-year-old married Iraqi woman, a mother of one child. At a very young age she learned how to use a sewing machine and create dresses for herself. As a result, she has 10 years of sewing and tailoring experience. 

She uses her skills to contribute to the family's income. From home she works on many sewing orders: from creating dresses to window curtains. She would like to make her work area a bit more comfortable and also buy a sewing machine and an iron to better provide for her customers. 

Gona took a loan from Relief International - Iraq to the amount of 1,800 USD to be able to make these purchases.

loans.use: to create a work area and buy a sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 57-year-old widow. She is supporting a family of seven members by working in farms. 

Fatmeh plants different types of vegetables every season, for example now she has planted lettuce and will start selling it in the market.  She has been in the farming business for 20 years. 

Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan to prepare the land for the next season and buy new vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to prepare the land for the next season and buy new vegetable seeds

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 44-year-old married woman who has three children. Her husband suffers from an illness that does not allow him to work. 

Since they do not have a source of income, Fatmeh started three years ago making different types of pickles such as cucumbers and olives. She also prepares and packs a variety of seasonings like thyme and sumac. After preparing all that, she sells them to friends, neighbors, and relatives. 

Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan in order to buy more bottles and jars to make more pickles. She hopes that one day she can open a special store to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more bottles and jars to make more pickles

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a conservative person, for that reason she asked her mother-in-law Refaa, who sometimes helps her, to appear in the photo in her place. 

Fatmeh is a 35-year-old married lady; she has six children. Her husband works at one of the Jordanian governmental entities. 

For four years, Fatmeh has been sewing and tailoring clothes, and doing special embroidery on dresses. With the help of her mother-in-law's experience Fatmeh gained a good number of regular customers. 

Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine that works on electricity for embroidery.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 33-year-old widow who is supporting two kids by doing her home-based retail business. Now that it's the winter season, she is selling things like blankets and bed covers. 

She has been doing her business for three years now and is managing to support her kids. Now Ghada has applied for a loan to buy more blankets and new products.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and new products.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben Dario se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora. Desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando en la venta de mercancía, y gracias a esto ha podido ir adquiriendo el conocimiento para atender a sus clientes. Ruben Dario actualmente se dedica a la venta de bolsas a diferentes tiendas de su municipio, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Ruben Dario ha conseguido una muy buena cantidad de clientes, la mayoría gracias al buen servicio que ofrece, y de esta manera ha podido salir adelante generando los ingresos suficientes para progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente suyo, el cual no puede cubrir con el inventario de bolsas que tiene en el momento. Tampoco cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar las bolsas que requiere, por lo que acude a un préstamo con el ánimo de comprar bolsas al por mayor que le permita atender el pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Ruben Dario espera poder seguir incrementando sus ventas e incrementar su capital, para poder que su negocio crezca y cumpla su sueño de tener una gran comercializadora de desechables.
texts.en:
Ruben Dario has defined himself by being a hardworking person.  From a very early age, he began working in the sales of merchandise.  Thanks to this, he has been able to acquire the knowledge in order to attend to his customers.  Ruben Dario currently sells bags at different stores in his town.  Thanks to this, he makes the necessary income to support his home.  Ruben Dario has obtained a good quantity of customers, the majority thanks to the good service that he offers.  In this way he has been able to move ahead, making enough income to progress and improve his quality of life.

Right now he has a large order from one of his customers, which he cannot meet with the inventory of bags that he has at the moment.  He also does not have enough money to buy the bags that are required.  This is why he is turning to a loan with the intention of buying bags at wholesale which will allow him to attend to the order that a client has made.

Ruben Dario hopes to be able to continue increasing his sales and increase his capital, in order that his business will be able to grow and fulfill his dream of having a big store of disposable products.

loans.use: buy wholesale bags which will allow him to attend to the order that a customer has made.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 29 años es una mujer soltera. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermano Fernando; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. A pesar de no tener un hijo propis, quiere mucho a los 2 niños que cuida en una casa, ahí viene trabajando 4 años y se siente feliz de poder criarlos. Cuenta que le pagan un salario mensual, con el que se mantiene; pero como le gusta ser independiente, también tiene el negocio de compra y venta de ropa durante las tardes y fines de semana. Para obtener su mercadería, viaja 2 veces al mes a la capital del país, en donde compra ropa importada y lo comercializa al crédito a los pobladores de su anexo, quienes ya la conocen por la buena ropa que trae, dentro de unos meses comenzaran a estudiar todos los niños del país, gracias a ello ya tiene pedidos de uniformes de escuela, “aprovecho siempre esta temporada”, afirma Luz. Pero como es una mujer del campo, también cría animales entre ovejas, cuyes y cerdos que vende en un restaurante, cada vez que están maduros. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “nueva esperanza” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Luz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales para aumentar su ganando, además de uniformes de colegio para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en: Luz is 29 years old and is single.  She lives with her parents and her brother Fernando; she takes care of them in their home, which is located in the community of Hualahoyo.  Although Luz does not have any children of her own, she loves taking care of the 2 children who live in a house where she has worked for 4 years, and she is happy that she can help raise them.  She receives a monthly salary for this work, which is how she earns most of her income.  However, Luz enjoys being independent, and also has a business selling clothing in the afternoons and on weekends.  She travels to her country’s capital city twice every month in order to re-stock her merchandise—she purchases imported clothing there, which she then sells to the residents of her community.  The people of her community know her for the nice clothing she sells.  Within a few months all of the children in the country will begin their studies, and thanks to the children in her area Luz already has orders for school uniforms.  “I always make the most of this time of year,” Luz declares.  Moreover, as a woman of the country, Luz also raises animals, including sheep, guinea pigs, and pigs, which she sells to a restaurant once they are mature.  Luz belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” [“New Hope”] solidarity group, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She hopes that a small loan will allow her to achieve her objectives.  Luz promises to make all of her payments on time, as she has done with her previous loans.  She is grateful to be part of the group, since all of the members are responsible and supportive.  With your support, Luz will use the money to purchase more animals so she can increase her herd, and also to purchase school uniforms to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more animals, and also to purchase school uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Vaneza

texts.es: Vaneza, de 23 años es una mujer soltera, vive en compañía de sus 6 hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chupuro. Durante la temporada de la escuela, cuida de sus hermanos en su casa de la ciudad, pues sus padres viven en el campo, donde no existen colegios para que ellos aprendan a leer y escribir. Antes alquilaba una peluquería en un espacio de su casa, que da a la plaza principal, pero terminó el contrato que realizó. Por ello está planeando abrir un restaurante donde pueda vender comida casera a los pobladores de su anexo, sabe que lo conseguirá, para ello trabaja muy duro en el bordado de mandiles, cuenta que hace un promedio de 8 faldas bordadas al mes, ganando muy bien por ellas, “lo que más cuesta es el arte”, cuenta. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir 3 máquinas entre rectas y simples, ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y espera consolidarse conforme pase el tiempo. Ya está ahorrando y espera pronto logar su objetivo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Vaneza de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de sillas y mesas para abrir su restaurante.
texts.en: Vaneza, 23, is a single woman who lives with her 6 siblings whom she cares for in her own home, located in the town of Chupuro.  During the school year she cares for her siblings in her house in the city, because her parents live in the countryside where there are no schools.  This way her siblings can learn to read and write.  Before, she used to rent out space for a beauty shop in her house, which overlooks the main square, but she finished that contract, so now she is planning to open a restaurant where she could sell home-made meals to the townspeople in her neighborhood. She knows that she can make this happen, because she works very hard embroidering aprons.  She tells us that she makes an average of 8 embroidered skirts a month, and makes good money for them.  "The most difficult part is the art," she says.  Over all of this time, she has managed to acquire 3 sewing machines, industrial and simple, and she now has 3 years of experience.  She hopes to consolidate the business over time.  Now she is saving, and she hopes to quickly reach her goal.  This will be her 4th loan with MFP, and she awaits a small loan so that she can reach her goals.  In addition, she pledges to comply with the payment terms, as she did with her previous loans.  She is grateful to be a part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible people who support each other.  Once Vaneza receives your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of chairs and tables so that she can open her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 17 years. He describes himself as jovial and organized. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located near a busy tarmac road and in a strategic area. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Ronald will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for selling. Ronald's  business goal is to purchase a vehicle to aid in delivery of charcoal to customers within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is 29 years old, married with one child. He does motorcycle transport to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years. He also runs a retail shop to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Harrison has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to grow his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
Jose Nicolas ha sido una persona que ha atravesado diferentes adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, su dedicación y ganas de salir adelante, le han permitido superar estas dificultades y progresar junto a su familia. Durante gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en graneros, distribuidoras y tiendas, y de allí aprendió la actividad para que hace cerca de 20 años decidiera montar su propia tienda general en la cual ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Jose Nicolas, gracias a su tienda genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Hace un tiempo fue victima de un saqueo de su tienda, y tuvo que superar con gran dificultad esta adversidad. 

Actualmente Jose Nicolas tiene muy buenas ventas y una gran cantidad de clientes, por lo que su inventario de mercancía ha disminuido considerablemente. Con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Jose Nicolas quiere comprar una vitrina y una estantería en la cual pueda ubicar más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, y poder así aumentar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Sin embargo, Jose Nicolas no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una vitrina y una estantería en la cual pueda exhibir los productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Jose Nicolas espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues tendrá una mayor oferta para sus clientes. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Jose Nicolas is a person who has gone through some hardships in his life.  However, because of his dedication and desire to get ahead in life, he has been able to overcome these difficulties and make progress with his family.  For most of his life, he has worked in granaries, and in wholesale and retail stores.  With the experience that he acquired over almost 20 years, he decided to establish his own general store where he offers basic consumer goods for sale.  Jose Nicolas, thanks to his store, is able to generate the income he needs to support his household, including his wife and their 3 children.  Some time ago his shop was looted, and this was an adversity that he overcame with great difficulty.

Now Jose Nicolas has good sales and a large number of customers, and so his inventory of merchandise has diminished considerably.  With the intention of increasing the quantity of products that he offers, Jose Nicolas wants to buy a glass display case and some shelving where he could place more products on display for his customers.  He also wants to buy a greater variety of products to offer them.  However, Jose Nicolas does not have enough capital to make all of these purchases, and so it is for this reason that he is hoping to get a loan.  This loan will provide him with the opportunity to buy a glass display case and shelving where he could exhibit the products that he offers to his customers.

Jose Nicolas hopes that in this way, his sales will increase a lot, as he will have more to offer to his customers.  In addition, he hopes that he will increase his earnings, and so will be able to provide his wife and his 3 children with a better quality of life and more opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a glass display case and some shelving so that he could exhibit the products that he offers to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has a daughter who is two years old. He describes himself as an aggressive and organized man. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located near a busy road, and his primary customers are pedestrians. He describes his biggest business challenge as the varying price of petrol. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. In the next five years, Francis's business goal and hope is to diversify his transportation business, which will generate income for buying a taxi for additional transportation services.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the needed tools and supplies for his construction business.

loans.name: Omaira Lucia

texts.es:
Omaira se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos a los que quiere brindarles la mejor educación posible. Desde hace cerca de 3 años, cuando se ganó una rifa, decidió con este dinero empezar a comercializar ropa a los habitantes de su municipio. Con el dinero que se ganó en esta rifa, compró ropa y empezó a venderla a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos, y así fue aportando ingresos para contribuir al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Omaira desde entonces ha incrementado sus ventas gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Gracias a los ingresos que genera Omaira, sus 3 hijos han podido gozar de una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Omaira actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente, el cual no puede satisfacer con el surtido que tiene actualmente, y tampoco cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar la compra de esta mercancía. Es por esto que Omaira espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de ropa para surtir su negocio y poder cumplir con el pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Omaira espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues el pedido es bastante grande y este clientes es bastante cumplido con el pago. Omaira sueña con que su esposo y sus 3 hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, y en un futuro sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria que les permita estar preparados para conseguir un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Omaira is married and is the mother of 3 children, and she wants to provide her children with the best possible education.  About 3 years ago, when she won a raffle, she decided that she would use this money to start a business selling clothing to the residents of her town.  With the money that she won in this raffle, she bought clothing and started to sell it to her relatives, friends and neighbors.  In this way, she was contributing income to support the household expenses.  Since then, Omaira has increased her sales, because of the good quality of her products.  Thanks to the income that Omaira generates, her 3 children have been able to enjoy a better education and a better quality of life.

Omaira now has a large order from a customer which she cannot fulfill with the stock that she has on hand, but she also does not have enough money to purchase this merchandise.  For this reason, Omaira hopes that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to make a purchase of clothing to stock up her business and also fulfill this large outstanding order.

Omaira hopes that in this way, her income will increase considerably, as this order is really big and this customer has a good payment history.  Omaira's dream is that her husband and their 3 children will have a better quality of life, and in the future the children will be able to get a college education that will prepare them to get a high-paying job.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock up her business and fulfill an order that one of her customers has made

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 35 years old and married with two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, and she has been in the business for one year. She does poultry farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business, and she hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 20,000 KES to buy rice, sugar, and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, fruits, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik was born in 1972 in Getahovit village in the Tavush area. After serving in the Armenian Army, Gagik married, and he now he has two school-aged sons. 

Since 1995, Gagik has engaged in cattle breeding and gardening. At his farm, Gagik is rearing two cows and two calves. In his garden he grows fruits for his family’s use. Sometimes Gagik produces cheese, which he sells to his neighbors. Gagik’s wife helps him with the farming. In addition to farming, Gagik has another occupation: he has a truck that he uses to carry cargo for individual and contract orders. 

Thanks to his two occupations, Gagik supports his family. He intends to develop his farm, and therefore he is seeking an 800,000 AMD loan to buy one more cow and five or six piglets for his farm. This is Gagik’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and some piglets for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional supplies, such as stones, for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and some textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbs and oils for his natural products business.

loans.name: Denia Yamileth

texts.es:
Denia de 38 años de edad, casada, con 3 hijos de 20,15 y 12 años de edad, los cuales estudian ella vive con su familia en la colonia quebrada seca en choloma, cortes.
Denia es ama de casa, pero hace 4 años ella estableció su propio negocio de una  pulpería donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos etc. Al cual le dedica todo el día, ella tiene la ventaja de atender a su familia y al mismo tiempo su negocio.
Ella inicio con fondos propios y con la  ayuda de Odef  incremento el inventario, y actualmente solicita un préstamo de L.10, 000.00 para invertir en compra de granos básico, refrescos, lácteos, y otros productos de la canasta básica.  Así poder ofrecer a los clientes variedad de producto y sus ventas pueda crecer más y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Denia, 38, is married and has three children who are 20, 15 and 12 years old who are studying.  She lives with her family in the Colonia Seca neighborhood of Choloma, Cortes.  Denia is a housewife but four years ago she opened her own business which is a grocery store where she sells basic grains, soft-drinks, dairy products, etc.  She spends all day there but has the advantage of being able to tend to her family while tending to her store at the same time.

She started out with funds of her own and with help from ODEF she increased her inventory and is currently requesting a L.10,000.00 loan to invest in basic grains, soft-drinks, dairy products and other basic staple items to offer her customers a wider variety of products so that her sales will increase more and she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 59 years old, and he lives in Koti village in the Tavush area. Suren is married and has four children: three daughters and a son. Suren’s daughters are married and live separately from their parents. 

For many years, Suren worked as a tractor driver at Koti village’s state farm. Since 1992, Suren has fulfilled private orders with his own tractor. At the same time he has his own farm where he raises and breeds a cow, some pigs, and chickens. He has a plot of land where he grows fruits and vegetables as well as fodder for his farm animals. At his farm, Suren has a fodder grinder: he buys batches of fodder to grind and sell. Thanks to his occupations, Suren has been able to provide for his family and organize his children’s weddings.

Suren is asking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves for his farm as well as a lot of fodder to grind and sell.

loans.use: to buy some calves and fodder to grind and sell.

loans.name: Sandra Cristina

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijas, vive en casa de su mamá junto con dos hermanas. Ella se dedica a la vender en las calles de su pueblo refrescos, yuca, enchiladas, entre otras cosas que les gustan a las personas, en los días de comercio u otros días feriados. Desde muy pequeña realiza esta actividad, pues su mamá también se ha dedicado a lo mismo, y Sandra le ayudaba a vender en un puesto que su mamá tiene todas las mañanas en el parque de su pueblo, pero cuando nació su primera hija Sandra aún siendo menor de edad se decidió en vender de manera ambulante refrescos, yuca, enchiladas, entre otras cosas más.

Los insumos que necesita para realizar sus ventas las compra en la tienda de su pueblo todos los días. Sandra desea dedicarse a la venta ambulante de ropa para dama y por eso esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones, entre otros artículos y con el tiempo ira agregando otros más. Con esta inversión espera recibir mejores ingresos que le permitan brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus dos hijas y ayudarle a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar. 

Ella lo que más desea es darles a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida, tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente viven en casa de su mamá. Espera que el préstamo se ha el empuje para ir creciendo y así lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Sandra, 22, has a spouse and two daughters; she lives in her mother’s house with two sisters.  She sells beverages, manioc and enchiladas, among other things that people like in the streets of her town during market or other festive days.  She’s been doing this since a very young age because her mother also did this and Sandra helped her to sell in her stand that her mother sets up every day in the town park.  But when Sandra’s first daughter was born while she was still a minor she decided to start being a street vendor of beverages, manioc and enchiladas, among other things.

She buys the ingredients she needs for her sales at a local store in town every day.  Sandra wants to start selling women’s clothes and this is why she’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan: to buy blouses, skirts and pants among other items and in time she will add still more.  With this investment she hopes to earn better income that will allow her to provide a good quality of life for her two daughters and help her spouse with household expenses.

What she most wants is to give her daughters a better quality of life and to have a house of her own since she currently lives in her mother’s house.  She hopes the loan will be the push to continue to grow and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que a pesar de su corta edad, ha tenido que pasar por diferentes adversidades en su vida. Con 29 años de edad, es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 6 años, debido a que quedó viuda pues su esposo murió hace un tiempo. Diana es una profesora de su municipio y gracias a esta actividad contribuía a los ingresos de su hogar, sin embargo, desde que murió su esposo ha visto como los ahorros se han disminuido y ha tenido que tomar la decisión de iniciar un nuevo trabajo. Con el ánimo de conseguir un trabajo alterno a la educación, Diana desea empezar a vender productos de uso personal, actividad que ha aprendido gracias a que anteriormente pagaba sus estudios con esta actividad. Diana espera que con esta nueva actividad, pueda generar mayores ingresos, pues en unas horas del día estará dictando clases y la otra parte del tiempo lo utilizará vendiendo mercancía. 

Diana, con el ánimo de surtir su negocio para poder ofrecerles los productos a sus clientes, desea comprar productos de uso personal, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como cremas, shampoo, lociones, accesorios, entre otros, y poder así tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes.

Diana espera que con esta nueva actividad alternada a su actividad como profesora pueda generar nuevos ingresos para su hogar, y poder ofrecerle a su hijo de 6 años una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who despite her young age has had to go through various adversities in life.  Just 29 years old and she’s a single mother head of household with a 6-year-old son because she was widowed when her husband died some time ago.  

Diana is a teacher in a town and thanks to this activity is able to contribute income for the home.  However, since her husband died she’s seen how her savings have dwindled down and she’s had to make the choice of taking on another job in addition to teaching.  

Diana wants to start selling personal use items, an activity she learned previously when she did it to pay for her studies.  Diana hopes that with this new activity she can generate higher income because she will teach classes for a few hours a day and she can use the rest of her time to sell merchandise.

Aiming to stock her business in order to sell products to her customers, Diana wants to buy personal use products but does not have sufficient capital to make these purchases which is why she hopes for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy personal use products like creams, shampoo and accessories, among other to have more merchandise to offer her customers.

Diana hopes that with this new activity in addition to her teaching she will be able to generate new income for her home and offer her 6-year-old son a better quality of life and access to a quality education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amable. Convive con Carlos quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Lilia es un restaurante de donde atiende como variados platos de la región y menús a su distinguida clientela, para lo cual tiene un local alquilado, pagando un precio cómodo que le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancias, ya que lleva 09 meses en ese local atendiendo a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su hijo mayor en sus tiempos libres para atender al público. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, ya que lo ha visto crecer iniciándose con venta de jugos, pasando  a la venta de comidas en una mesa ambulatoria, ahora contando con un local, sabiéndose ganar un buena clientela, y le deja buenas ganancias. Ahora su plan es comprar el local donde tiene alquilado su restaurante. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues cuenta con su apoyo permanente. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas para mejorar la comodidad de sus clientes, así como también los ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
Lilia, 35, is an enterprising, cheerful and very kind woman.  She lives with Carlos who is a merchant and they have two children who are 19 and 8 years old; they live comfortably in their own house.

Lilia’s business is a restaurant where she tends to her distinguished customers with various regional dishes and daily menus.  She rents the space for her restaurant and pays a modest rental fee which allows her to have a larger profit margin.  She’s been in this spot taking care of customers with help from her oldest son in his free time for nine months.  She likes the business because it’s given her much personal and economic satisfaction because she’s seen it grow having started just selling juice and then passing on to meals at an ambulatory table and now with an actual locale.  She has succeeded in winning over a regular clientele and it produces good profits.  Her plan now is to buy the locale where she currently rents space for her restaurant.

This will be MFP loan #11 and she hopes for a small loan that will help her meet her objectives.  She feels happy in her communal bank because she can count on permanent support.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy tables and chairs to improve customer comfort as well as ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Alva

texts.es: Alva, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y amable con interés de sobresalir. Convive con Alexander quien es independiente, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos de 16, 7 y 3 años de edad, habitando juntos en su propia casa. La a actividad que realiza Alva es la venta de carne de pollos, para esto cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, el cual alquila desde hace 02 años. Es así que desde muy temprano atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, asimismo cuenta con la ayuda de un jovencito al cual paga por día trabajado con un importe de 10 nuevos soles. Le gusta su negocio pues lo considera rentable ya que le deja las ganancias necesarias para poder pagar sus gastos personales, así como  la alimentación de sus hijos y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.  Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras luego de un tiempo no quieren pagar. Ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues le han apoyado en todo a lo que está agradecida. Con el monto solicitado de 1800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de pollos vivos buscando los mejores precios por su compra en la misma granja de aves para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alva, age 39, is a hard-working and kind woman, who is interested in doing well.  She lives with Alexander, who is independent.  They have three children, ages 16, 7, and 3 living with them in their own house.

Alva sells chicken meat, and she has a stand in the city market, which she has been renting for two years.  Starting very early she very kindly tends to her customers.  She has help from a young man, and she pays him ten nuevos soles per day worked.

She likes her business, and she considers it to be profitable.  It produces the needed income to be able to pay for her personal expenses as well as food for her children.  She can also help her life partner with the household expenses.  On the other hand, she does not like it when some of her customers ask for credit for their purchases, and after a time they do not want to pay.

She now has plans to continue with her business and to make it grow.  This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She therefore hopes for your participation in order to continue with her objectives.  She is comfortable with her communal bank.  They have supported her in everything, and for that she is grateful.

She will use the requested 1,800 soles to buy live chickens.  She is looking for the best prices for her purchase at the same poultry farm in order to get greater income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de  Jesús se considera una señora trabajadora se dedica a la venta de bolsas para dama  y a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años.
Ella tambien  nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de jarafones con agua.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Simon un señor trabajador y humilde con quien tiene cuatro hijos por quien los dos trabajan para darles un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa y mas dulces para la venta.
Le da las gracias fundación por confiar en ella y apoyarla para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
María de Jesús considers herself to be a hardworking woman who has been dedicated to selling women’s purses and clothes for the last two years.  She also sells large containers of bottled water.  

She is happily married to Simon who is a humble, hardworking man; they have four children that the two of them work hard for to provide them a better future.

She asked for the loan to buy more clothes and candy to sell.  She thanks the Fundación for trusting her and supporting her so that her business can grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional spare automotive parts for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 4 children whose ages range from 3 years to 11 years. She describes herself as entrepreneurial and innovative. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs one staff member. Her primary customers are a cooperative society. She describes her biggest business challenge as fluctuating milk prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a calf. Margaret's business goal is to own ten more cows within 5 years. She hopes to venture into rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy one calf.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a lively, cheerful Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children. 

Learning to sew at a young age, she has many years of experience and great skills, and since 2010 she has been actively working on serving customers and their orders in addition to creating dresses and materials needed for her family and home. 

Working from home, she would like to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator to ensure electric power as well as an iron and some small items for her work area. 

Fatma took a loan from Relief International - Iraq in the amount of 1500 USD to be able to make these purchases.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a generator

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es una mujer casada desde hace 18 años con el señor Carlos que se dedica a hacer diversos trabajos de albañilería, juntos procrearon 3 hijos que actualmente estudian, la mayor está cursando el primer año de prepa, el que le sigue va en tercer año de secundaria, y el más pequeño estudia en quinto año de primaria, toda esta familia vive en una comunidad mazahua del estado de México, con paisajes montañosos, con muchas milpas, y de mucha vegetación y ríos.

La actividad que la señora Concepción realiza es la compra y venta de ropa, durante la semana Concepción recorre las casas vecinas ofreciendo ropa, si hay alguna prenda que Concepción no tenga, les toma pedido y tiene que viajar a la capital del estado de méxico todos los viernes que es cuando se pone el tianguis y puede comprar en mayoreo a buen precio, ya que ha surtido su pedido regresa a su casa y nuevamente en el transcurso de la semana recorre las casas en las que le hicieron pedido y les entrega su ropa, ella les vende en abonos, ahora que les ha entregado la ropa acuerdan una fecha para pagarle, y ella regresa el día acordado por el dinero.

Concepción es cliente de FRAC desde hace 5 ciclos en los que ha sido muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos, en esta ocasión comprará con el préstamo que recibirá: chamarras, faldas, camisas, sueteres, pants, ropa interior, etc. para tener mercancía y ofrecerla y el resto lo ocupará para los pedidos que ya le hicieron, ella tiene ya 4 meses de experiencia en este tipo de actividad.

A Concepción le gustaría en un futuro tener su propio local y poner un negocio establecido en el que ya no tenga que salir a las casas a ofrecer, esto le ahorraría tiempo y dinero, ella está muy agradecida con el apoyo que a recibido de FRAC y KIVA para realizar sus metas, y desarrollar de forma adecuada su negocio.
texts.en:
Concepción has been married to Carlos for 18 years; he does various bricklaying jobs and they have three children currently attending school.  Her oldest is in first year of high school, the next one is in third year of secondary school and the youngest is in fifth grade of elementary school.  The entire family lives in a Mazahua community in the State of México that has mountainous terrain with lots of corn fields, vegetation and rivers.

Concepción’s activity is buying and selling clothes.  During the week she goes from house to house offering the clothes and if there’s some items she does not have she takes the order and then travels to the state capital every Friday which is when the street market is set up and she can buy at wholesale for good prices and once she’s stocked up on her order she returns home and once again spends the week going from house to house where orders were placed delivering the clothes.  She sells on installments.  When she delivers the clothes they agree on a date to pay and she returns on the agreed upon day to collect the money.

Concepción has been a FRAC client for five cycles in which she’s been very responsible and punctual with her payments.  On this occasion she will use the loan she’ll get to buy jackets, skirts, sweaters, pants, underwear, etc. to have merchandise to offer and she will use the rest for the pending orders she already has.  She has four months’ experience in this type of activity.

In future, Concepción would like to have a store of her own and install a permanent business and not have to go house to house anymore; this would save her both time and money.  She is very grateful for the support she’s gotten from FRAC and Kiva to reach her goals and to develop her business in an adequate way.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer de 42 años de edad que esta casada con el señor Basilio el cual es un trabajador del campo, es un agricultor, este matrimonio vive en una localidad mazahua al norte del estado de México, juntos tuvieron a 4 hijos que dependen aún de ellos, el mayor va en tercero de secundaria, el que le sigue va en tercero de primaria, uno más va en el kinder aún y el más pequeño es un bebé todavía, su localidad se caracteriza porque se desarrollan actividades como, la agricultura, comercio, ganadería, etc.

La actividad de María consiste en la compra y venta de ropa al mayoreo.  La señora María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entre semana recorre las casas vecinas ofreciéndoles ropa y tomándoles pedido, los fines de semana ella va a la capital mexiquense a surtirse de todos sus pedidos, ella es cliente de FRAC desde hace ya 5 ciclos en los que se ha visto enormemente beneficiada por los créditos que KIVA les otorga.
En esta ocasión María solicita este préstamo para comprar mercancía como: Sueteres, pantalones, chamarras, faldas, camisas, ropa interior, etc.

Su proceso lo realiza de la siguiente manera, pide un préstamo FRAC, invierte el dinero en pedidos, y ropa extra para la venta, reparte los pedidos casa por casa, acordando dejarles la mercancía y posteriormente cobrarles cada 8 días, después vuelve a invertir su dinero en lo mismo, ella no ofrece tan lejos su mercancía sólo lo hace en casas cercanas, y lo hace caminando.

En un futuro le gustaría comprar un carro para transportarse a otras comunidades y de esta manera ampliar sus posibilidades de venta, y si le va bien poner su propio local para ya no tener que salir, ella tiene ya 6 años de experiencia realizando esta actividad por lo que sabe que le irá muy bien con el apoyo de KIVA.
texts.en:
María, 42, is married to Basilio who is a field hand; he’s a farmer.  This couple lives in a Mazahua community in the north of the State of México; they have four children who still depend on them.  The oldest attends third year of secondary school and the next one is in third grade of elementary school.  Another one goes to Kindergarten and the youngest is still a baby.  Her community is characterized by activities like farming, commerce, animal husbandry, etc.

María’s activity is buying and selling clothes at wholesale.  María is a very hardworking woman who spends the week going to her neighbors’ houses offering clothes and taking orders.  On the weekends she travels to the state capital to fill all her orders.  She’s been a FRAC client for five cycles in which she’s been enormously benefitted by the Kiva loans she’s been granted.  On this occasion, María is asking for this loan to buy merchandise like sweaters, pants, jackets, skirts, shirts, underwear, etc.

This is how she does her work:  She asks FRAC for a loan, invests the money to fill orders and to buy extra clothes to sell.  She delivers the orders house to house agreeing to leave the merchandise and later collect payment every 8 days.  She then reinvests the money the same way.  She does not sell too far away; she only sells to nearby houses and she does it on foot.

In the future, she’d like to buy a car to transport herself to other communities to expand her sales possibilities and if she does well to open her own site in order not to have to go out anymore.  She has six years’ experience doing this activity so she knows she’ll do well with help from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es una mujer de 49 años de edad que se encuentra casada con el señor Ismael que se dedica a realizar diversas actividades de albañilería, ya no tienen hijos que dependan de ellos. Viven en una localidad mazahua donde las actividades que se desarrollan son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La actividad económica que la señora Concepción realiza es criar animales en su caso toros de engorda, ella compra los toros en su centro municipal, los lleva a su casa donde los cría de la siguiente manera: Compra el alimento, lo prepara, se los da a sus toros, los desparasita constantemente cada 8 días, los vitamina durante un mes y medio, y les da su alimento y cuando cumplen 5 meses bajo estos cuidados, los vende. Ella los ofrece en su municipio en las carnicerías y a veces a clientes particulares.
La señora Concepción es clienta de FRAC desde hace ya 5 ciclos en los cuales ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para comprar 2 reses, en este negocio dice que lleva ya un año y medio.

Concepción es una mujer muy soñadora que cuando experimentó el criar reses se dio cuenta que es una buena inversión y que dice que en un futuro le gustaría seguir comprando mayor cantidad de reses y comprar más alimento y criar de 7 a 8 toros y un día tener su propio carnicería
texts.en:
Concepción, 49, is married to Isamel who does various bricklaying jobs; they have no dependent children.  They live in a Mazahua community whose activities are farming and animal husbandry.

Concepción’s economic activity is raising animals; in her case it is bulls.  She buys the bulls in her municipal center and takes them home where she raises them and fattens them up thus:  She buys feed, prepares it and gives it to her bulls.  Every eight days she constantly treats them for parasites and gives them vitamins for a month and a half.  She feeds them and when they have spent five months under this care she sells them.  She sells them in her town to butcher shops and sometimes to individual customers.

Concepción has been a FRAC client for five cycles in which she’s been very punctual with her payments.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy two bulls.  She says she’s been in this business for a year and a half.

Concepción is a dreamer and when she experimented with raising cattle she realized it’s a very good investment and she says that in the future she’d like to continue buying larger numbers of cattle and more feed to raise between 7 and 8 bulls and someday have her own butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy two bulls to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es una mujer de 52 años que se encuentra casada desde hace 30 años con el señor Tomas, el cual se dedica a hacer diversos trabajos de albañilería, ellos ya no tienen hijos pequeños que dependan de ellos, ambos viven en una comunidad mazahua con muchos paisajes verdes, montañas y ríos, en donde las principales actividades económicas que se desarrollan son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Cristina se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace ya cuatro años, su actividad consiste en buscar los borregos que comprará ya sea en su comunidad o en su centro municipal, los lleva a su casa donde los criará, posteriormente se encarga de cuidarlos, para su alimentación ocupa zacate, e incluso compra alimento especial, también los inyecta para que engorden y en el transcurso de 5 meses ella los puede vender.

Cristina es cliente de FRAC desde hace 5 ciclos en los que se ha comprometido y ha pagado puntualmente, está muy agradecida por el apoyo que ella ha recibido gracias a los préstamos, en esta ocasión ella comprará 3 borregos, pequeños que engordará y alimento y cuando crezcan los venderá en su comunidad a los barbacoyeros, que son personas que se dedican a hacer barbacoa.

Las metas de Cristina son en un futuro comprar más borregos y hacer una granja capaz de abastecer a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Cristina, 52, has been married to Tomas for 30 years; he does various bricklaying jobs and they have no minor children who depend on them.  They both live in a Mazahua community with much green scenery, mountains and rivers where the main economic activities are farming and animal husbandry.

Cristina has been raising sheep for four years now.  Her activity consists in finding the sheep that she’ll buy either in her community or in her municipal center.  She takes them home where she will raise them and then takes care of them feeding them grass and she also buys special feed.  She injects them so that they will gain weight and in five months’ time  they are ready to be sold.

Cristina has been a FRAC client for five cycles in which she’s been committed and has paid punctually.  She is very grateful for the support she’s received thanks to the loans.  On this occasion she will buy feed and three small lambs that she will fatten up and when they are grown she will sell them to people who make barbecue.

Cristina’s goal in the future is to buy more sheep and create a farm with the capacity to supply many customers.

loans.use: to buy four lambs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, vive en compañía de ellos en una casa que está a su cuidado. La actividad que realiza Zonia es la crianza de pollos y la venta de bebidas gaseosas, siendo el lugar de ventas la casa que habitan por el momento. Hace 25 años que empezó con la venta de pollo, teniendo una granja, con el paso del tiempo, hace dos años, instaló una refrigeradora donde ahora mantiene sus bebidas gasificadas, realizando la venta de éstos. Le gusta su negocio pues le generan el ingreso económico necesario para pagar sus gastos del hogar, así como alimentación y vestir y otros gastos, ya que aprendió de su vecina quien le dio la idea de iniciarse en ese negocio. Ahora teniendo ya su negocio en marcha tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo invirtiendo sus ganancias, asimismo está buscando ampliar su galpón dond pueda criar un mayor número de pollos. Este será el préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para implementar su galpón como bebederos y comederos de pollos, así como  alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
Zonia, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who very much wants to make progress.  She’s separated from her children’s father and lives with them in a house she’s taking care of. 

Zonia’s activity is raising chickens and selling soft-drinks; for the moment, her sales point is the house they live in.  She started selling chickens 25 years ago; she had a farm.  With the passage of time, two years ago she installed a refrigerator where she now stores her soft-drinks to sell.  She likes her businesses because they generate income needed to pay household expenses like food, clothing and other expenses.  She learned from a neighbor who gave her the idea to go into this business.

Now that her business is in operation she very much wants to grow reinvesting her profits and she’s also looking to enlarge the shed so that she can raise a larger number of chicks.

This will be MFP loan #8 and she’s hoping for your collaboration so that she can make her plans a reality.  She is very happy in her communal bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible, supportive people.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy building materials to furnish her shed like water troughs and feeders for the chicks as well as to buy nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and nutritionally balanced fowl feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El gripo se llama las naranjas y se integra de  seis personas  quien cada una se  dedica a su respectiva actividad.
  
      Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama   Rosa Linda  ella es madre soltera  y a su responsabilidad  tiene  a un hijo   que eta estudiando.
 
     El préstamo  que ella solito es para invertirlo en la compra de ropas, para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños en donde lleva trabajando   tres años tres meses en la   que comentó que le va bien ya que con ello a mejorado mucho sus ingresos en sus hogar y negocio.


     Inicio con su   actividad por si sola ya  que con ello pensó que así  podrá sacar adelante  a su familia   que es lo más importante para ella  y con la ayuda de dios lo está logrando.

      Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo   ella puede seguir trabajando para  así  poder seguir apoyando a su hijo que está  a su responsabilidad.
 
      Las persona que integran  en el grupo son: silvina  invertirá el préstamo en  la compra de productos agrícolas, María vitalina  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de comenticos de la marca fuller, la señora  teresa  invertirá en la compra  y  veta de ropas, la señora Carmen invertirá en la compra  y venta de útiles escolares  y por último la señora  Hilda invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The “Las Naranjas” (the Oranges) group consists of 6 people who all have their own type of business.

Rosa Linda, a single mother with one son who is in school, gave the interview.

She will use the money from the loan to buy clothing for women, men, and boys and girls. She has been in this work for three years and three months and she told us that it’s going well and has helped her improve her earnings for her home and business.

She started the business on her own because she thought it could get her family  ahead.  This is most important for her and with God’s help, she is succeeding.

What she wants most with this loan is that she can continuing working to help her son because he is her responsibility.

The other members of the group are: Silvina, who will use the loan to buy farm products, María Vitalina will buy Fuller cosmetics, Teresa will buy and sell clothing, Carmen will buy and sell school supplies, and finally, Hilda will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He sells oranges, bananas, and mangoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for fifteen years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, mangoes, and oranges.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes, and oranges.

loans.name: Mais

texts.ru: Mais 34 goda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Mais jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. On uje 11 let kak delayet plastikoviye okna i dveri. Mais seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti i instrumenti chtobi pochinit apparati s pomoshyu kotorix on delayet plastikoviye okna i dveri. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Maisa, on udachno oplatil pervuyu ssudu, ona ochen pomogla v razviitiye yego biznessa. Mais ochen blagodaren Kive i lenderam za ssudu.
texts.en: Mais is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. Mais lives in the Absheron region together with his beloved wife and children. He has been manufacturing plastic doors and windows for eleven years. Right now Mais needs 2,000 AZN to buy necessary spare parts and tools to repair equipment which he uses to make plastic doors and windows. This is Mais' second loan and he has successfully repaid the first loan which has really helped him in growth of his business. Mais is very grateful to Kiva and lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts and tools to repair equipment.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 38-year-old married woman. She has two daughters, ages 14 and 17 years. She describes herself to be aggressive and passionate about education. 

Joyce operates a primary school where she provides education. She has been involved in this business for ten years and employs five staff members. Her business is located at a fast-growing area and her primary customers are students' parents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the school. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more students' desks. Joyce's business goal is to expand to secondary school and college within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be the best education provider in the country.

loans.use: to purchase more students' desks.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica, a 43-year-old married mother of one, has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for 15 years, and earns additional income from rice retailing and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Jessica is requesting a loan of PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Makenzi

texts.en:
Makenzi is 51 years old and married with three children. He runs a green grocery store to earn a living; he has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. He also owns a retail shop. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a 15,000 Kenya shillings loan to buy cabbages and oranges to sell.

loans.use: To buy cabbages and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, a 38-year-old resident of the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda, is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Andrew has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks such as soda and beer.

To help expand his business, Andrew has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more soda and beer for resale. This will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Andrew hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a bar and a restaurant.

Andrew is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Andrew who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old. For the past two years he has sold posters to earn a living. He describes his market as good because there is limited competition.

Since Patrick joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards. He has applied for a 17,000 KHS loan to buy more posters to sell. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more posters to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 48 years old and married with three children. For the past two years she has sold tea and loaves of bread to earn a living. She has had one employee.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Catherine has been able to expand her business. She has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more sugar, tea leaves and milk. Catherine hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, tea leaves and milk.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 29 years old and married with three children. He runs a store where he sells produce such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges. He has one employee.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Juma has been able grow his produce business. He has applied for a 40,000 KES loan to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

Juma hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children; one of them is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her stationary shop, which sells books and has a photocopy machine. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationary materials, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Betty hopes that in the future, she will be able to own another branch of the same business. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stationary materials.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con sus dos hijos, es comerciante de ropa y crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad para ofrecer a sus hijos lo necesario, ya que es única fuente de ingresos permanente.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, además comprara cerdos para la granja, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener la mercadería necesaria para atener la clientela.
El objetivo de Claudia es que a través de los préstamos pueda permanecer bien en el negocio, teniendo una fuente de ingreso segura para los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her two children. She is a clothing merchant and raises pigs. She learned this business due to the necessity of offering her children what is necessary, and this is her only source of permanent income.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy garments such as blouses, skirts, and underwear, and also she will buy pigs for the farm. This purchase will permit her to grow and to have the necessary merchandise in order to assist her customers.

Claudia’s purpose is that through the loans she can continue doing well in the business, having a secure source of income for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and underwear

loans.name: Jose Celin

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo, solamente él trabaja en la familia, dedicándose a la venta de medicinas, lo aprendió por sus amigos quienes le enseñaron la manera de trabajar con medicinas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos como vitaminas, curativas, analgésicos, entre otras, con este préstamo lograra aumentar el inventario para tener mayor diversidad de productos.
La aspiración de José es mejorar el negocio, crecer en clientela y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, his wife and a child, he is the only one working in his family, and he works selling medicines. He learned from friends who taught him the way of working with medicine.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy medicines such as vitamins, curatives, painkillers, among other items. With this loan he will be able to add inventory in order to have a great diversity of supplies.

José’s ambition is to improve the business, to increase his clientele, and improve the family income.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamins, curatives, pain killers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has over twenty years of residential and commercial cleaning experience, with a specialty in pressurized washing services. Longing to be his own boss and not rely on others for financial security, Pablo set out to create his own cleaning business. “I like being independent and providing for me and my family,” said Pablo. 

While Pablo knew that there was a demand for pressurized washing, it was no simple task opening a business – especially during an economic downturn. Pablo was able to apply his expertise and professional connections to tap into the Miami cleaning market – provided cleaning services  for homes, pools, fences, sidewalks, patios, garages and roads. 

“I’m proud the business I’ve built has weathered the storm,” explained Pablo. Pablo needs an ACCION USA loan for $10,000 to purchase a new piece of equipment/machinery that will allow him to expand his services to include city properties.  He has licensing throughout the state of Florida and would like to expand his services statewide.

loans.use: to purchase a new piece of equipment.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha, 48 years old and widowed, is supporting seven sons and daughters on her own.

To be able to do that, Maha has been running a small home retail business selling blankets for four years now. She sometimes adds more products based on what her customers ask for.

Now Maha has applied for a loan to add new products such as clothing and home products to increase her income, to be able to support her kids as they are growing up.

loans.use: to add new products such as clothing and home products to increase her income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to establish a farm business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Omaima

texts.en:
Omaima, 54 years old and widowed, was left with three daughters and a son to support.

For two years, Omaima has been running a small business selling home accessories especially those made of straw; she also sells ladies' lingerie. She has applied for a loan today to expand her business to include selling blankets and make-up products since most of her clients are female.

loans.use: to expand her business to include selling blankets and make-up products.

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Tsira is from the village Odilauri, West Georgia. She is 31 years old, married and lives with her family: husband David, 7 year old son, 3 year old daughter and parents in law (retired). 

Tsira and David are running a family agricultural farm. They have a milk cow, produce cheese and sell it in the local market. They also own 300 vine-trees. David produces wine and sells it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Tsira requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two cows they will be able to double the amount of produced cheese and increase their income, which will allow them to improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef, 39 years old and a married man, opened  a grocery store three years ago and added more products each year as an enhancement to the store.
