Now Yousef has applied for a loan to increase the quantity of goods he has at the store so he can cover the needs of the neighborhood.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods he has at his store.

loans.name: Ana Elvia

texts.es:
Ana Elvia es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y disciplinada en su hogar. Casada y con 5 hijos, Ana Elvia se dedica a la venta de mercancía con el ánimo de poder brindarles a sus hijos y su esposo una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que el sueldo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, Ana Elvia decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el cual pueda contribuir con ingresos a sostener los gastos de su hogar. Ana Elvia vende prendas de vestir para dama y sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos. Debido a que un cliente le ha hecho un gran pedido, Ana Elvia requiere comprar los productos a su proveedor, sin embargo, no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta compra. Es por esto que Ana Elvia ha recurrido a un préstamo con el ánimo de que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para entregar el pedido que le ha hecho un cliente.

Ana Elvia espera que con la ayuda de este préstamo su negocio siga vendiendo y pueda seguir generando ingresos para su hogar. Ana Elvia sueña con que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y con que su esposo y ella puedan gozar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Elvia is a person who has been known to be a hard working person and dedicated to her home. She is married with 5 children. 

Ana Elvia works selling merchandise with the aim of being able to provide her children and her husband a better quality of life. Because the salary that her husband earns is not sufficient in order to pay the household expenses, Ana Elvia decided to open her own business with which she can contribute income to pay the household expenses. 

Ana Elvia sells clothing for women and her main clients are relatives, friends and neighbors. Because a customer has made a big order, Ana Elvia needs to buy the products from her supplier, however, she does not have the necessary money in order to do this purchase. This is why Ana Elvia has appealed for a loan with the purpose of providing the possibility of making the purchase of clothing in order to fulfill the request that the customer has made.

Ana Elvia hopes that with the help of this loan for her business she can continue selling and can continue generating income for the household. Ana Elvia’s dream is that her children can have a good education and that she and her husband can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing to fulfill a request a client has made

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past year, Rose has been working hard to manage her stationery business, which provides photocopying services and sells exercise books.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more paper for photocopy machines and books for resale. The loan will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another computer. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy paper and books

loans.name: Agustina Del Socorro

texts.es: La emprendedora Agustina  Del Socorro es una cliente activa de Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio intachable. La actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a todos sus clientes que son de la misma localidad. Agustina Del Socorro está solicitando actualmente financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, aceite, jabón, huevos, pan, entre otros productos.
texts.en: The entrepreneur, Agustina del Socorro, is an active client with Fundación León 2000 and has shown that she is a responsible person with an impeccable credit record.  Her business is a general store in her house where she takes care of all the customers from her area.  Agustina del Socorro is requesting a loan to use for her business to buy sweets, basic grains, oil, soap, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, oil, soap, eggs, bread, etc

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past one year, William has been working hard to manage his health clinic, which sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale and will help William to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. William hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a bigger one. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita sells groceries and cosmetics at  Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Anita has been selling groceries and cosmetics for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband with expenses related to the general upkeep of their family. Anita will use her loan to purchase more groceries and cosmetics. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire a shop for the sale of the groceries and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and cosmetices for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his small business, which does metal fabrication. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another machine to help him in his business. It will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more machines and open up another branch of the same business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy another machine to help him in his business.

loans.name: Banga Nzambe Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie, age 50 and married, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Banga Nzambe Plus,” which is composed of 29 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Marie started her business in 1980. Today, she makes loaves of bread and sells fresh fish at her place located east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received 19 different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing some sacks of wheat flour and some fresh fish and resell them with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of 50 USD. Her ambition is to open a cold storage facility.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and fresh fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 47 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser amable y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, vive en compañía de ellos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza María es la venta de bebidas gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, donde tiene guardada y a temperatura helada sus bebidas. Su negocio se concentra en su misma casa, donde acuden sus clientes en busca de una bebida fresca. Dicho negocio se inició con un préstamo de MFP hace 01 año y hasta el momento ella sola se hace cargo. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos a los que quiere mucho, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve muy seguido pues le dificulta la venta de su producto, ya que depende del clima caluroso para vender. Ahora tiene planes de aumentar la variedad de sus productos con bebidas energizantes y yogurt. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores así como yogurt para variar sus stock.
texts.en:
María, age 47, is a very hard-working and dedicated woman in addition to being kind and friendly.  She is separated from the father of her children, and she lives with her children in her own house.

María sells soft drinks.  To do so she has a refrigerator that she bought with her savings.  That is where she stores her drinks and keeps them cold.  Her business is in her own house, where her customers come looking for a cool drink.

She started her business a year ago with a loan from MFP.  So far she takes care of the business herself.  She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and take care of her young children, whom she loves very much.  Also, the income the business generates for her is to pay for the household expenses.  On the other hand, what she does not like is when it rains often; it makes it difficult to sell her product.  She depends upon a warm climate in order to sell.  She now has plans to increase the variety of her products with energy drinks and yogurt.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She therefore hopes for a small loan in order to be able to meet her objectives.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers them to be responsible and supportive people.  She will use the requested 1,000 nuevos soles to buy different brands and flavors of soft drinks and yogurt to vary her stock.

loans.use: to buy different brands and flavors of soft drinks and yogurt to vary her stock.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Более 5 лет Рачаб занимается купле продажей курного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он очень трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он очень любит свой бизнес и еженедельно ездит на рынок за покупками скота, затем откармливает и  заново продает  на рынке. Рачаб запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajab has been involved in buying and selling cattle and small livestock for more than 5 years.  He is a very hardworking and conscientious man.  He loves his business and goes to the market every week to buy livestock, which he fattens up, and then resells at the market.  Rajab is requesting a loan to buy livestock in order to expand his business.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Dario Arturo

texts.es:
Dario es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, y gracias a esto ha podido superar diferentes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Dario se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 17 años a la atención de bares, gracias a que de joven aprendió la actividad trabajando en un bar de su región. Actualmente Dario tiene su propio bar el cual administra, y gracias a este genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Dario atiende en su bar diferentes tipos de clientes, lo que hace que su bar sea visitado por gran cantidad de clientes. Dario en el momento requiere de hacerle algunas mejoras locativas a su bar, como pintar algunas paredes y mejorar algunas instalaciones; debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas mejoras locativas, acude a un préstamo con la esperanza en que este le pueda brindar la posibilidad de acceder a realizarle mejoras locativas a su bar. 

Dario espera que de esta manera su bar pueda aumentar en ventas, pues tendrá un mejor aspecto y atraerá a más clientes. Dario sueña con que su bar se convierta en un gran bar donde pueda emplear a muchas personas que requieran de un salario y no tengan oportunidades laborales. Además, sueña con poderles ofrecer a su hijo y a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progresar.
texts.en:
Dario is very dedicated to his job and to his family and thanks to this he has been able to overcome different obstacles that have passed in this life. For approximately the last 17 years Dario has made a living bar tending, thanks to the fact that when he was young he learned how while working in a bar in his area. Dario now has his own bar which he manages and which thankfully provides the necessary income for his household. Dario serves many types of customers in his bar, and his bar is frequented by a high volume of customers. Right now Dario needs to do a few improvements to his bar, like paint the walls and to improve some of the amenities. Due to the fact that he doesn't have sufficient capital to do these improvements, he has requested a loan with the hope that it will provide him with the possibility to accomplish the improvements to his bar. 

Dario hopes that in this way his bar will be able to increase it's sales, by having a more attractive look that will bring in more customers. Dario's dream is that his bar will grow so that he will be able to employe many people who need a salary and don't have other employment opportunities. Additionally, he dreams to be able to offer his son and his wife a higher quality of life and better opportunities to progress.

loans.use: Realizarle mejoras locativas a su bar.

loans.name: Pedro Humberto

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicinas, solamente él trabaja en la familia, esta ocupación la inicio con la ayuda de unos amigos, trabaja en lo propio, de forma ambulante.
El necesita realizar la compra de mas productos medicinales, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a incrementar el negocio como vitaminas, medicinales (para dolores, infecciones), esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y diversificar sus productos.
La aspiración de Pedro es tener un negocio rentable, capaz de generarle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro resides with his wife and two children. He sells medicines and he is the only worker in his family. Pedro began this occupation with the help of some friends. He works on his own, selling in the streets.

Pedro needs to buy more medicinal products to sell. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to help increase his business, buying vitamins and medicines (for aches and infections). This investment will help him strengthen his business and diversify his selection of products.

Pedro's ambition is to have a profitable business, capable of generating the income needed to support his family.

loans.use: buy vitamins and medications to sell.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; two of them are currently in school. For the past two years, Bena has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more commodities and will help Bena to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Bena hopes that in the future, she will be able to build her house. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Bena who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities.

loans.name: German Atilio

texts.es:
Germán, se dedica a la agricultura y venta de ropa, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él inicio el negocio desde joven, la agricultura la aprendió de su padre, trabaja en su casa, sin tener un horario establecido.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada, para iniciar el proceso agrícola con la nueva siembra.
La aspiración de él es tener buenos resultados de la siembra, con la ayuda de este préstamo, ya que su objetivo principal es tener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Germán makes a living as a farmer and selling clothing. He lives with his wife and three children. He started his business when he was young; he learned about agriculture from his father. He works in his home without having a set schedule for work. 

He has requested a loan to buy agricultural products like fertilizer, herbicides and genetically engineered seeds, to start the process of planting a new crop. 

His aspiration is to have good results from his crop, with the help from this loan, as his main objective is to have good results.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and genetically engineered seeds.

loans.name: Krissia Noemy

texts.es:
Krissia, vive en casa propia, junto a dos hermanos de 16 y 14 años de edad, ella es madre de un niño de 7 años, el padre del niño la apoya, al igual que sus padres, Krissia se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, chancletas, esta venta la realiza de manera ambulante, lo aprendió por la necesidad de tener una ocupación que le genere ingresos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior y mochilas escolares, para mantener variedad en el negocio, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad del negocio, con más oportunidades de venta.
La aspiración de ella con el negocio es crecer, abarcar más mercado, comprarse un pick up para trasportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Krissia lives in her own home with her two brothers who are 16 and 14 years old. She has a 7 year old son, the father of her son helps support them, as well as her parents. Krissia makes a living selling underwear and sandals, which she does by selling in the street. She learned to do this out of necessity to have a job that would provide income. 

She has requested a loan to buy underwear and school backpacks, to maintain variety in her business. This investment will help her to be able to improve the availability of her business, with the opportunity to sell more things. 

Her aspirations are to grow the business, to increase her market and to buy a pick-up to transport her goods.

loans.use: to buy underwear and school backpacks.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice operates a grocery shop and also sells rice in Adum Banso. She is married to a farmer and has two children.

Eunice has been operating this grocery shop for six years now. With her income, she supports her husband in feeding their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 43 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad se dedica a realizar las actividades agrícolas, fue su papá quien le enseño a sembrar maíz y a realizar  las actividades agrícolas desde hace 20 años. Él vive solo con sus hijos ya que su esposa lo abandono, pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante junto con sus hijos, por ellos se sacrifica.  Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ordeñar y darle de comer a sus animales, para luego irse a trabajar a sus parcelas de tierra, a la 1:00 p.m. se regresa a su casa a almorzar y ha estar con sus hijos que llegan de la escuela.  

Francisco tiene que viajar para comprar los insumos, en una ciudad que esta a una hora de su hogar en autobús. 

Él solicita un préstamo para comprar más insumos agrícolas, terminar de abonar su milpa y rastrear otra parcela de tierra. Dice que con esta inversión él podrá abonar y sembrar más para obtener mayores ingresos para el sustento de su familia y poder comprar una vaca para incrementar la producción de leche. 

Francisco piensa enviar a sus hijos a la universidad y por esa razón el trabaja muy fuerte.
texts.en:
Francisco is 43 years old and married with 2 children. Since he was 10 years old, he has been dedicated to agricultural activities. It was his father who taught him to sow maiz and practice farming activities some 20 years ago. Francisco has lived alone with his children ever since his wife abandoned them. But this hasn't impeded him from forging ahead with the children; he sacrifices for them. 

Francisco gets up at 4:00 am to care for and feed his animals, then goes to work on his parcels of land. At 1:00 pm he returns to his house for lunch and to be with his children who are returning from school. Francisco must travel by bus to buy farming supplies in the city about 1 hour from his home. 

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, to finish fertilizing his corn field, and to clear another parcel of land. He says that with this investment, he will have fertilized and planted more land in order to obtain greater income to sustain his family, and to be able to buy a cow to increase milk production. 

Francisco hopes to send his children to the university, and for this reason, he works very hard.

loans.use: to buy more agricultural supplies, finish fertilizing his corn fleld, and clear another parcel of land.

loans.name: Courage Plus Group

texts.en:
Germaine earns a living by selling beverages, corn and manioc flour, a business she started in 1997. Germaine is 57 years old, a widow and the mother of five children. Currently through her sales, Germaine makes about $180 per week. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having four times received and properly repaid loans. She is planning to reinforce her working capital with her next loan and increase the inventory of her business. She is happy right now, as she is going to be able to buy some sacks of corn and manioc flour and a sack of beans to resell at a profit. She works hard because she wants to expand her business.

Germaine is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Courage Plus” which is composed of 29 microentrepreneurs united to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying some sacks of corn and manioc flour and a sack of beans in order to resell at profit

loans.name: Mopepe Ya Sika Plus Group

texts.en:
Mesmin is a chairman of a Community bank named “Mopepe ya sika Plus”, which is composed of 23 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mesmin is 42 years-old, and single. He runs a telephone booth and is a money changer. He started his business in 1976. With hard work and determination, his business prospered. Mesmin’s business is located in the mid east of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received twice Hope DRCongo’s loans and repaid them correctly. He intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards and increase the inventory in order to reinforce the working capital. He makes $60 profit each week. His dream is to open a transportation enterprise in Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid cards and increase inventory in order to increase  profits.

loans.name: Loboko Plus Group

texts.en:
Sabine is a chairwoman of a community bank named "Loboko Plus," made up of seven members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Sabine sells fruit and other miscellaneous items. She sells them in a market located in the western part of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1997. She has borrowed ten loans from MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion, and she fully repaid them. With the next loan, Sabine will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. She will buy two sacks of fruit to resell for a profit. Her business makes 35 USD in profit each week. One of Sabine's strategies for keeping her clients is to tell them in advance about any change that can occur in business. Her ambition is to become a fruit provider. She is 55 years-old. She is married and has four children between ages 30 and 38 years old who are independent.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fruits to resell them at a profit.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 65 years old. He lives in Samtredia District, West Georgia, with his family: his wife Mzevinar; his 36-year-old son; his daughter-in-law; and two grandchildren (15 and 3 years old). 

Shota works as a cook in the village. Also, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. In particular, the family runs a small dairy farm with two cows and two calves. They sell cheese to local dairy-products retailers. Also, the family has two pigs and sells on average 18 piglets annually on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Shota’s family owns 1 hectare of land where maize is grown. They sell up to 1 tonne of maize per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris. 

Shota requested credit for purchasing a tractor. Shota and his son will provide tilling, moving and other seasonal agricultural services to farmers in the Samtredia District. They will earn additional income and will be able to improve the family's living conditions, as well as finance the education of the children.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor for agricultural work.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a fish monger  at Adum Banso  near Takoradi. She buys fresh fish from the market, smokes it and then sells it.  She has been into this business for 11 years now.  Abena is  marrried to a driver and has three children.  Abena  assists her husband to feed and cloth their children. Abena will use her loan to purchase more fish which she will smoke and then sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more fish which she will smoke and then sell.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es:
Gabriel es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable en su trabajo y con sus hijos. Desde hace un tiempo la madre de sus 2 hijos los abandonó y desde entonces ha tenido que salir adelante solo con ellos dos. Gabriel anteriormente estaba empleado en una empresa de estampación de camisetas, y gracias a esto aprendió la actividad. Al ver que su negocio era muy mal pago decidió independizarse y desde entonces tiene su propio taller de estampación y gracias a este genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. En el taller Gabriel tiene gran reconocimiento por la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece, y esto ha hecho que sus ventas aumenten cada vez más con el paso del tiempo. Debido a que no tiene una gran capacidad de producción puesto que no tiene gran cantidad de herramientas de trabajo, Gabriel a veces debe sobrepasar su carga laboral y trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche, lo que hace que se desgaste y a veces conseguir algunas enfermedades. Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Gabriel quiere comprar algunos implementos de trabajo que le permitan ser más eficiente ocupando menos tiempo, y de esta manera pueda atender a sus clientes que le piden grandes pedidos. Sin embargo, Gabriel no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de los implementos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de trabajo como marcos de estampación y pinturas que le permitan realizar más estampaciones en menos tiempo y poder atender a los clientes que le realizan grandes pedidos.

Gabriel espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues de esta manera podrá acceder a clientes que antes no podía atender debido a su poca capacidad de producción. Además, Gabriel sueña con brindarles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Gabriel is someone known for being very responsible in his work and with his children. Quite a while ago the mother of his two children abandoned the family, and since then he has had to find a way to move forward with his children. 

Gabriel was previously employed in a business where they did t-shirt printing, and thanks to that he learned how to do this. His job was not well paying so he decided to go out on his own and since then he has had his own printing shop. It is thanks to this that he is able to generate the necessary income to support his household. In his shop Gabriel is well known for offering high quality products, which has resulted in his sales increasing more and more with the passing of time. 

Gabriel doesn't have the capacity for large production because he doesn't have a lot of work tools. Sometimes his workload is too high and he has to work late into the night, which wears him out and sometimes causes him to get sick. With the desire to improve this situation, Gabriel wants to buy some work tools which will allow him to be more efficient and take less time, and also be able to offer service to customers who place large orders. However, Gabriel doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to buy the tools. It is for this reason that he hopes this loan will give him the opportunity to buy the tools he needs, like printing frames and inks that will allow him to make more prints in less time and be able to provide service to customers who place large orders. 

Gabriel hopes that as a result his sales will increase considerably, because he will be able to provide service to customers who before he was not able to, due to the small production capacity he has. Gabriel dreams of being able to provide for his two children a better quality of life and better opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy tools for work like printing frames and inks that will allow more prints in less time so he can provide service to customers who place large orders.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is the lady pounding fufu (a thick snack paste) in the picture.  She operates a chop bar (a place where a variety of African dishes are sold) and she has done this the last two years.

The foods she serves are fufu, banku (fermented dough) and rice balls.  She is married with two children.  Efua uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profits, Efua plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: purchase food and other ingredients to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is from the village of Chkvishi, West Georgia. He is 43 years-old, married and lives with his family: his wife, Inga; their four year-old son and his mother. Agriculture is the source of income for the family. They have a small dairy farm with two cows and six calves. Inga produces cheese and sells it at a local market. Also the family owns a plot of land where melons and watermelons are grown. Harvested melons and watermelons (on average 10 tonnes per year) are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris, including the monthly pension of Abel’s mother. 

Abel requested credit for renting a tractor for land cultivation and for purchasing fertilizers. After proper cultivation and fertilizing the family will get good income. Abel and Inga plan to use received income for renovation of their house, as it is already old and needs some repair.

loans.use: to pay for renting a tractor for land cultivation and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is 44 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in West Georgia with his family: wife, Nino, and 3-year-old son. The only source of the income for Pridon and Nino’s family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. The family sells cheese at the local market. Also, they own a greenhouse where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. Pridon sells his harvested vegetables locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 laris. 

Pridon requested credit to purchase a new polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. After purchasing a new cover, as well as fixing some parts of the construction, the greenhouse will maintain the needed temperature. Pridon will be able to bring in a good income and will sell at a convenient price. This will contribute to the sustainability of the family’s income which is mainly used to cover daily expenses for the child and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene cover for his greenhouse

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 46 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of one school-age child. Emma used her last loan to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional snack items to expand her product offering. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es:
Stephanie  es una mujer de 30 años quien estudió Mecánica Dental en el Colegio Universitario de Cartago, provincia de Costa Rica
 Ahora esta casada y tiene un niño de un año. Ella  ha trabajado como interina en el Hospital Calderón Guardia, y ahora que su  mama   le da la posibilidad de construir un pequeño laboratorio en la parte del frente de su casa,  ella podrá realizar ahí su trabajo que consiste en elaborar prótesis  y otros aparatos que se utilizan en la corrección y salud dental, los cuales venderá  a odontólogos y ortodoncistas . 
De esta forma ella podrá desarrollar su profesión en forma más estable para tener mejores ingresos y más adelante  sacar otra carrera. Stephanie es una muchacha que se esfuerza para superarse y desea transmitir esto a su pequeño hijo dándole un ejemplo de que las mujeres pueden realizarse en muchas áreas , como personas, mujeres y  profesionales.
texts.en:
Stephanie is a 30 year old woman who studied dental mechanics in the University of Cartago, province of Costa Rica. Now she is married and has a one year old son. She worked as an intern in the Calderón Guardia Hospital and now her mom has given her the opportunity to build a small laboratory in the front part of the house. There she will be able to work making prostheses and other devices that are used in dental correction and dental health, which she will sell to dentists and orthodontists.

In this way she will be able to further develop her profession in a more stable way to have better income and later on be able to obtain another degree. Stephanie is a woman who has fought to succeed and wants to pass this on to her small son, giving him an example that women can be many things, as people, woman and professionals.

loans.use: to buy the necessary equipment for her dental laboratory.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children. The family is currently residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jenelyn used her last loan to purchase motor tires and headlights to improve the service quality. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to repair the vehicle used in her trnasport business. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transportation business

loans.name: Betzie

texts.en:
Betzie is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and married with 5 children. 

To make a living, Betzie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Betzie has been in her business for 4 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

Betzie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, Betzie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Alicia's Group

texts.en: Alicia, left, is married with 3 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamiz City. Alicia owns and operates a flower shop to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional flowers for her business. Alicia has been a member of PMPC for a year and 6 months. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business. Alicia is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business

loans.use: to purchase additional flowers for her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 64 years old and is widowed with six children. Elisa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 60 years old. He is from the the village of Bashi, West Georgia. Nestor is married and lives with his family: wife, Maguli; 19-year-old son and mother. The only source of income for the family, along with Nestor and his mother’s pensions, is agriculture. In particular, the family owns three milk cows. They sell 40 kg of cheese per month on average at the local market. Also, the family has a pig and sells 12 piglets per year on average. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 laris. 

Nestor’s family also owns a greenhouse with a total area of 260 sq meters, which is already old and needs renovation. Nestor requested credit to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation and to cover it with a polyethylene cover. After the greenhouse is renovated, the family will grow vegetables. They will sell their harvested crop and get additional income which will be used to improve family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a 29-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Richel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living; she's been in this business three years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Richel wants to build a house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her general store's product offerings.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. She is 24 years old. Grace is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Grace runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community. Grace has been in her business for three years and earns 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Grace is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2007, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her general store's product offerings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wholesale stock of beer and liquor and thus be able to continue offering her customers a great variety of products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and has three children. Rowena is 33 years old and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Rowena owns and operates a business venture, providing hairdressing services to local community members to earn a living; she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more dresses to expand the services provided. 

In 2007, Rowena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses to expand services provided.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y laboriosa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, pero vive con ellos en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Elsa es la preparación y venta de comidas para una familia, por lo que a diario siempre les cocina. Lleva más de 8 años realizando esta actividad, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico además de considerar su negocio fácil de realizar y no le consume mucho tiempo permitiéndole dedicarse a otras actividades, además de recibir su pago de manera puntual cada fin de semana. Tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse cómoda con su grupo solidario pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes principales a precio por mayor como arroz, aceites, azúcar y otros.
texts.en: Elsa, who is 46 years old, is a hard-working and industrious woman who has much will to succeed. She is separated from the father of her children, but she lives with them in her own house, which she bought with much effort. Elsa's business is the preparation and sale of foods for a family, so she always cooks for them daily. She has been doing this work for 8 years, running her business in a friendly and cordial manner. She likes what she does, since it permits her to have an income, and in addition, she considers her work easy to do, and it does not consume much time, permitting her to spend time on other activities, in addition to receiving her pay punctually at the end of every week. She has plans to open a restaurant in her house. This will be her second loan with the MFP institution, therefore she hopes for your support to continue with her goals. In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers it to be a united and responsible group. With the 1200 PEN that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of basic ingredients at wholesale prices, such as rice, oils, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, oils, and sugar.

loans.name: Narda

texts.en:
Narda is 56 years old with 5 children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City: Philippines. 

To earn a living, Narda owns and operates a business venture, providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been in this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics & materials. 

In 2007, Narda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en: Mansueta is married with 12 children. Mansueta is 56 years old and lives in Montol, Ozamiz City. Mansueta has a general store to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and sacks of rice for her business. Mansueta has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mansueta hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and sacks of rice for her business

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.es: Jefferson, de 31 años de edad es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso. Convive con Alicia quien es ama de casa, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad a los que quiere muchos, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Jefferson es la de trabajar en el taller de mecánica de motos, cuyo negocio está en sociedad con su cuñado. Dicho negocio está instalado en un local alquilado en una zona transitada cerca al mercado de su ciudad. Le gusta su negocio pues cada fin de semana logra ver recuperar su inversión más sus ganancias. Tienen planes de ampliar el local y poner a la venta repuestos para motos y lubricantes. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su grupo solidario pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y lubricantes para ponerlos a  la venta en el taller que tiene.
texts.en:
Jefferson is 31 years old; he is hard working and persevering. He lives with his partner, Alicia, who is a housewife; as a result of this union they have two children, 5 and 3 years old, whom they love very much. They live in their own home. Jefferson makes a living working in a repair shop for motorcycles; he owns this business in partnership with his brother-in-law. The business is located in a rented space that is in a busy area close to the market in his city. He likes his business because each weekend he sees return on his investments plus additional profits. He has plans to expand the location and have an area to sell motorcycle parts and oil.  

This will be his second loan with MFP; he hopes for your support in this to be able to see his plans through. In addition to being comfortable with his solidarity group (in MFP), he knows the members and considers them to be responsible people and united. With the requested loan of 1200 nuevos soles he will invest it in buying parts and oil to put up for sale in the repair shop that he has.

loans.use: to buy parts and oil.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a married woman who has 4 children. She is 44 years old, and resides at Gango, Ozamis City: Philippines. Milagros owns and operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and she has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2007, Milagros joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Milagros wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна работает в детском саду  нянечкой она мать 3 детей. Её муж работает мастером по евро-ремонту, а также  устанавливает пластиковые окна.  Она получает свой кредит для покупки мебели. Летом она провела ремонт, теперь хочет обновить мебель в квартире. Она имеет на руках наличные деньги, а на не хватающую сумму получает кредит.  С нашей организации  сотрудничает с 2010 года
texts.en: Mavzuna works as a kindergarden teacher. She is a mother of three. Her husband renovates people's homes and installs energy-efficient windows. She is taking this loan to purchase furniture. She repaired her apartment in the summer and now would like to upgrade the furniture. She has some cash, and is taking the loan to cover the rest of the purchase. She has been with MDO Arvand, LLC since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her home

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en: Jecil is married with one child. Jecil is 22 years old and lives in Bongbong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Jecil is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase piglets and feeds. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jecil hopes to have another business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Lodilyn

texts.en: Lodilyn is a married woman who has 2 children. She is 30 years old and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lodilyn owns and operates farm land, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This year, Lodilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lodilyn wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru: Иван использовал предыдущий кредит для ремонта двигателя своего автомобиля, который он использует в качестве такси. Сейчас Иван хочет приобрести более новый автомобиль. У него есть часть денег, но ему нужны дополнительные средства. Новый автомобиль будет требовать меньше ремонта, а поэтому Иван сможет использовать больше прибыли для нужд семьи. Иван очень открытый, искренний человек, пользуется уважением у своих клиентов и друзей.
texts.en:
Ivan's previous loan was spent on repairing his car which he uses to taxi people. Now Ivan wishes to purchase a new automobile. He has part of the money, but not the whole required amount. 
A new car would require less repairs, allowing Ivan to spend more money on his family, not the car. Ivan is a very open and honest person; his clients and friends think highly of him.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина замужем. Ее супруга зовут Данил. У них два взрослых сына. Ирина имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Ирина занимается выращиваем ранних овощей на протяжении 9 лет. Она решила заняться этим бизнесом, так как это дело является перспективным для данного региона. Сейчас Ирина имеет четыре больших теплицы и теплицу для рассады.  Она трудолюбивая и ответственная, имеет желание развиваться. 

Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 20,000 гривен  на постройку дополнительной теплицы. Недавно Ирина приобрела новый участок земли и хочет успеть построить на нем новую теплицу до начала сезона. Кредит поможет Ирине увеличить доход, и тем самым улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Irina is married to Danil. They have two grown sons. Irina has run her own business for nine years. She grows early vegetables. Irina decided to go into this business because it's very prospective  for her region. Right now, she has four large greenhouses and a "nursery" greenhouse, for seedlings. 
Irina is very responsible and hardworking with a desire to expand her business. She's asking for a loan of 20,000 grivnas in order to build a new greenhouse. Irina recently purchased a new plot of land and wishes to build her greenhouse on it before the season starts. This loan will allow Irina to increase her income and the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван женат. Его супругу зовут Юлия. У них есть маленькая дочь. Иван имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Иван занимается выращиванием ранних овощей на протяжении 4 лет. На сегодняшний день у него две большие теплицы и две теплицы для рассады.  Иван скромный сельский житель, но имеет большое желание развивать свой бизнес. Его бизнес цель: построить еще две большие теплицы.

Иван просит предоставить ему кредит на сумму 12,000 гривен на закупку семян, пленки и удобрений. Кредит поможет ему увеличить доход, и тем самым улучшить благосостояние молодой семьи.
texts.en:
Ivan is married to Yulia and they have a small daughter. He's also run a business for four years. He cultivates early vegetables in greenhouses. Currently, he owns two greenhouses and two greenhouse "nurseries." 
Ivan is a modest countryman but with a strong desire to expand his business. His goal is to build two more greenhouses. Ivan's asking for a loan of 12,000 grivnas in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and greenhouse cover materials. This loan will allow him to increase his income and the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and greenhouse cover materials.

loans.name: Cover Girl Group

texts.en:
Nabawiyah is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children who are still attending school. She and her husband cooperate together to meet their family's expenses. Wanting a better life, Nabawiyah started her business in 2011 selling shoes, socks and accessories on credit. Her business is going well but sometimes she has a problem with people who are late in paying their installment. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more inventory to increase her number of customers. She sells shoes, sandals and accessories door to door around her neighborhood. In the future, she wants to have her own store and have enough savings to send her children to a better education.

Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses such as washing laundry, running a general store and selling juice.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, sandals and accesories to sell on credit

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two adult children. Fe is 49 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamiz City.

Fe sells snacks (suman) such as rice cake wrapped in banana leaves to earn a living and has had this business for 27 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchased lumber, plywood and other building materials for house repair.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Fe hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchased lumber, plywood and other building materials for house repair.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 52 years old and lives in P12 Northern Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three adult children. To earn a living, Teresita has a bakery. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a widow with one adult and two school-aged children. Loreta is 57 years old and lives in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City.

Loreta sells snacks (siopao, which is a meat-filled bun) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase raw ingredients used to make siopao.

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Loreta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients used to make siopao.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with three adult children and one school-aged child. Elisa is 52 years old and lives in Baybay Sta. Cruz, Ozamis City.

Elisa sells ready-to-wear items to earn a living, and has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to purchase more items like shirts and pants for trading.

Elisa is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Elisa hopes to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shirts and pants for trading.

location.town: Ozamiz - Baybay Sta. Cruz, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Emelda Group

texts.en: Emelda is married with three children. Emelda is 46 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Clarin. Emelda owns and operates a silver jewelry accessories business to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional silver for her business. Emelda has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Emelda hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase additional silver for her business

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is married and has four children. Jerry is 30 years old and resides in Segatic Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jerry used his last loan to purchase fertilizer. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to pay for services to increase crop yield. In the future, he hopes to be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Ailet

texts.en: Ailet is a married woman with one child. Ailet is 24 years old and resides at Tabid, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ailet owns & operates a business selling seafood products such as seaweed and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seaweed to sell. Recently this year, Ailet joined GDMPC to access financial assistance. In the future, Ailet wants to build a house and to finish the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: This time Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 17,000 to fund her fruits and vegetables retail business. The firewood business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Rosemarie and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a married woman who has four children. Susana is 52 years old and resides at Liposong Ozamis City, Philippines. Susana plants, harvests and sells bananas and corn to earn a living and she's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2007, Susana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Susana wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Denes

texts.en: Denes is 38 years old and married. He is the father of four school-aged children. The family lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Denes used his last loan to purchase an aquarium to sell cultured goldfish and other decorative fish. His business is successful and he is taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to raise. In the future, he hopes to be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Flora May

texts.en: Flora May is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 32 years old. Flora May is married and has one child. To make a living, Flora May owns and operates a business providing computer services to local community members. Flora May has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. Flora May is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional computers to improve the business. Recently this year, Flora May joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old. Florita is married and has five adult children. Florita owns & operates a swine business, raising pigs for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Maria Luzmila es conocida entre sus vecinos, familiares y clientes por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y a su hogar.
Maria Luzmila se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos a los que quiere brindar siempre la mejor calidad de vida.

Maria Luzmila se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la actividad de la confección, gracias a la cual recibe los ingresos con los que aporta al sostenimiento de los gastos del hogar.
Maria Luzmila tiene una buena clientela, la cual le permite generar unos ingresos constantes, sin embargo, los ingresos no son muy altos.
Gracias a que un cliente le realizó un pedido de unas prendas de vestir, Maria Luzmila requiere comprar la materia prima para la confección de este pedido, sin embargo, en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de esta materia prima; es por esto que tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como las telas, hilos, entre otros, para poder confeccionar este pedido que le ha hecho un cliente y seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar.

Maria Luzmila sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo, y pueda tener algún día un taller rentable que le permita ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos una estabilidad económica y un futuro en el que tengan la oportunidad de progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Luzmila is well known by her neighbors, friends and customers for being very dedicated to her job and her home. She is married with two children and always wants to offer them the best quality of life. 

Maria Luzmila has worked as a dressmaker for most of her life. Thanks to dressmaking, she has been able to use her income to covert the household expenses. She has a good client base which lets her generate a consistent income. However, her income is not very high. One of her customers recently requested she make some fancy dresses. She will need to buy raw materials to fulfill this order, however, currently Maria Luzmila does not have sufficient capital to purchase these raw materials. A loan would help her purchase these materials such as fabrics, thread, among other things and continue generating income for her household. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that one day she can rent a workshop that would allow her to offer her children a stable economic future so that they can also have the opportunity to progress economically.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as fabrics and thread to make a dress requested by a customer.

loans.name: Maria Nydia

texts.es:
Maria Nydia ha sido una persona capaz de superar muchas adversidades que se le han presentado en su vida. Con 61 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos a quienes quiere brindarles lo mejor.	
Hace aproximadamente 30 años su esposo se quedó sin empleo, por lo que recurrió a vender comida a las personas de su sector. 
Por aquel entonces empezó a vender fritos como empanadas, morcilla, entre otros, y un hijo suyo en ese entonces muy pequeño le colaboraba repartiendo la comida por todas las calles del sector. Al ver que el negocio le estaba dando utilidades con las cuales podía sostener un poco las necesidades básicas de su hogar, Maria Nydia decidió seguir realizando esta actividad como método de generación de ingresos.

Actualmente Maria Nydia sigue desempeñándose en la misma labor, y ya tiene un puestito de ventas de comidas a las afueras de su vivienda. Gracias a esta actividad sigue colaborando con los gastos de su hogar, y ha permitido que su esposo y sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria Nydia, para continuar con su actividad requiere de la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, y la compra de una pipeta de gas. Sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital disponible para la compra de estos productos, por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y la compra de una pipeta de gas para fritar sus alimentos.

Maria Nydia sueña con que su negocio crezca, siga vendiendo cada vez más, y pueda así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y a su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria Nydia has been a very capable person in overcoming the many challenges that life has presented to her. She is 61 years old, married and has two children, to whom she'd like to offer the best in life. Thirty years ago, her husband was unemployed and Maria came up with the idea of selling food to people in her area. Since then, she has sold empanadas, blood sausage, among other things. When she started, one of her sons, who was very young at the time, helped her distribute the food on all the streets in the area. When she saw that the business was very useful and she could sustain the basic necessities of her household, Maria Nydia decided to continue working and generating income. 

These days Maria Nydia continues doing the same work and has a small stand where she sells food outside of her home. Thanks to this activity, she continues contributing to the household expenses and has given her husband and children a better quality of life. Maria Nydia needs a loan for the purchase of materials needed to make her dishes and to purchase a pipette of gas to fry them. However, currently she does not have the available capital to purchase these products. She has put her hopes on a loan and the opportunity it would give her. She dreams of growing her business, and sells more each day. In this way, she can continue to give her husband and sons a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase the ingredients to prepare her foods and to buy a pipette of gas to cook them.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
Jose, un sencillo campesino que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo , el habita en la comarca El Rosario localizada en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí , a sus 32 años ya es padre de familia tiene un pequeño hijo que asiste a la escuela. El trabaja sembrando granos básicos junto con su padre uno de los productos que mayor demandan tiene es el frijol también de igual manera el maíz. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar 2 bueyes que le ayuden arar la tierra para sembrar sus granos básicos. Que de hecho es una de sus metas sembrar 1manzana de frijol y una manzana de maíz. El espera sea una cosecha de muy buena calidad que le ayuden a pagar los costos de producción y permita volver a invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Jose has been a simple farmer since he was very young and is committed to working in agriculture. He lives in the region of El Rosario, located in Pueblo Nuevo, city of Estelí. He is 32 years old and the father of a young son who goes to school. He works planting basic grains along with his father. Beans and corn are highly demanded. He is using the loan to buy two oxen to help him prepare the land to plant the seeds. In fact, one of his goals is to sow one block of beans and one block of corn. He hopes that it will be a very good quality harvest that will help him to cover the costs of production and allows him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 oxen

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en: Marvie is married and has 2 children. Marvie is 39 years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Marvie owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,440.00 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Marvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marvie wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Solomon is married and has one child. To make a living he plants, and harvests, corn to sell. Solomon has been engaged in his business for 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 a month for these activities. In 2004, Solomon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solomon is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is 46 years old and married with 9 children.

Edda works hard to provide for her family. She makes and sells nipa in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Edda has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been making and selling nipa for 5 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Edda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Emma is married and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture making and selling ice cream to local members. Emma has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 27 years old, married with two children. She runs a car wash business to earn a living and has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. She earns extra income from poultry farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save some income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a car wash machine.

loans.use: To buy a car wash machine

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en:
Adolfa is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Adolfa is married and has 6 children. 

To make a living, Adolfa runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Adolfa has been in business for 25 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Adolfa is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Adolfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 55 years old and married with 5 children. He sells chips to earn a living, has been in the business for 4 years and has employed three people. He earns extra income from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 45,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes for making chips.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for making chips

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is married with 8 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristeta is 44 years old and has 7 children who are in school.

Cristeta has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Cristeta requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and so she can repair her fishing boat.

Cristeta has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Cristeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra is from San Roque, Ozamis City. She is 63 years old. Cleopatra is widowed and has 7 children. 

To make a living, Cleopatra owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Cleopatra has been engaged in business for 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Cleopatra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleopatra is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en:
Nabat is a 33 year old Iraqi woman, married and a mother of three children. Busy with house chores, she was baking bread at the time Relief International-Iraq staff visited her in her home. With the children now being old enough to attend school, she started to use her sewing skills to help bring in some income for the family. 

She learned to sew at a young age, and for 2 years now she has been working from home on her old machine to meet customers needs and orders, making dresses and small household items. Nabat would like to buy a new sewing and oversewing machine to make her work more efficient and be able to provide different types of services, designs and be more creative with the orders. In order to make these purchases, Nabat a took a loan of 1,500 USD from Relief International-Iraq.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing and oversewing machine

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Rosalie has been in this business for 4 years. Rosalie earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Melibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fishing vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Melibeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing/fishing vending business.

Melibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is thirty-five years old, married, with one child aged three. He runs a video show business to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a plasma television.

loans.use: To buy a plasma television.

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en: This time Bernagen is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her guitar-making business. The guitar-making business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Bernagen and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wood, strings, glue and copper.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is thirty-seven years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Meliza works very hard to provide for them.

Meliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her general store. Meliza has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future Meliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en: This time Florites is borrowing PHP 13,000 to fund her variety store business. The fruit and vegetables business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Florites and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is forty-four years old and married with four children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. Nilda has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for four years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.
