She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell in her dried fish vending business. Gloria has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is a widow and has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

Neneth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to pay for maintenance of her internet cafe business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Neneth  would like to build and expand her business to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Racquel works hard to support her family. 

She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading. Racquel is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen products for her frozen foods business.

Racquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of frozen products.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti is a female adult, thirty-six years of age. She runs a general merchandise business in Kagadi, Uganda. She has operated this business for five years now. She faces a problem of theft and price fluctuations and her dream is to expand her business into other markets. Gorreti wants a loan to buy plastic seats and plates for sale.

loans.use: to buy plastic seats and plates for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is thirty years old, married and has a one child in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Maricel has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she continue to send her child to school and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Revocatus, is in his late fifties and is married with six children. He has been running a dispensary for ten years now. He works 24 hours a day and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Revocatus’s twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the stock of medicines and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase further his stock of medicines. Revocatus’s dream is to one day open a nursing school.

Revocatus will share this loan with his loan group, "Tupendane", which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to add stocks of medicines.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodina is 42 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Melodina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melodina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for five years. Melodina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 36 year old lady from Homabay town, western Kenya and is married to Barrack and they have 3 children aged 7 to 15 years.

Hellen operates a cereal selling business and has been doing this for the last year, making a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more maize cereal stock.  Her profits will be channeled to educating her children.

Her dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a stock of Maize cereal to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a female aged thirty-one, married, with four children and living in Kagadi, Uganda. She runs a stationary business which she has operated for nine years. She got capital from her husband to start the business. 

She wishes to educate her children up to university level. Her business is affected by price fluctuations and her dream is to trade in wholesale. Harriet wants a loan to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Thereza is a 44 year old married lady with 3 children living in Kasese Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

She has been in the agricultural business for the last 4 years and her major hardship has been high costs of feeds, however, she has a goal of expanding her business into new markets. Theresa wants a loan to help her pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Tujinasue Group

texts.en:
Martha is in her late fifties and is married with four children. She has been selling soft drinks for two years now.  She works from 8am to 6pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Martha’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of soft drinks and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks. Martha’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Martha will share this loan with her loan group, Tujinasue, which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is thirty-three years old, married with two children. He sells loaves of bread to earn a living. He has been in the business for eleven years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy loaves of bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a male adult aged forty who lives in Kagadi, Uganda with his two children and his wife. He runs a produce business. He started it after getting money from a small shop which he used to operate. The business is affected by late payments by customers. Joseph dreams of buying a car, building a permanent house and expanding his business to new markets. 

Joseph wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a thirty-nine year old married man with seven children living in Kagadi, Uganda.

He runs a butcher business which he has operated for a period of eight years. He started his business with capital he borrowed from a friend who was running a money-lending business. He faces a problem of clients not paying on time and high transportation costs.

Vicent dreams of having his children educated and buying land to set up a ranch. Vincent wants a loan to buy cows for beef sales.

loans.use: to buy cows for beef sales.

loans.name: Selever

texts.en: Selever is a twenty-nine-year-old man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are buying a car and building a permanent home. He has been in farming for the last four years and his major hardships have been inflation, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase the necessary supplies. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow more crops and of hiring employees to help expand his farm. Selever wants a loan to plant cabbages, buy sprays and buy feed for his pigs.

loans.use: to plant cabbages, buy sprays and buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Birabwa

texts.en:
Birabwa is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Birabwa has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a mini-supermarket. 

Birabwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Birabwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale,

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 31 years old and married with three children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 58 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living with a poultry business in the Philippines. She has been in the business for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and growing vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in her vegetable and fruit vending business. Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Erma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to build a house for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 46 years old and married with two children. He does photography to earn a living, and has been in the business for 5 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera.

loans.name: Helenia

texts.en:
Helenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.

Helenia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Helenia would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 25000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional ingredients such as milk, sugar, etc. for her Cafeteria business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as milk, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 45 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through  Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Johna has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Johna aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucilita

texts.en:
Lucilita is 56 years-old and married with one child in school. Lucilita works very hard to provide for them.

Lucilita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

Lucilita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Lucilita would like to save money in order to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Rosita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Maria is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. 

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Fredlick

texts.en:
Fredlick is 29 years old.  He sells men's and women's jeans to earn a living and he has been in this business for two years.  He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since Fredlick joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy men's and women's jeans to sell on.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's jeans to sell on.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 47, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dol, a consultant, and is a mother to her three children.  She, together with her husband and children, manages her own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling

Arlene operates a thermal paper and chlorine distribution business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  She also retails RTW products for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19, 000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her business. She will also invest a portion of the loan into having a new stall.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional products needed in her business.

loans.name: 030819-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dục works in agriculture; farming poultry and cattle.  She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to resell.  Dục has been involved in this business for nine years.

Dục is 38 years old and she is married with two children.  She is the leader of a four member group, the 030819-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Dục joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dục has successfully repaid one loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Dục faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Dục hopes to travel for vacation internationally, to buy a cell phone, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to resell.

loans.name: 030715-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mong works in agriculture; farming poultry and cattle.  She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.  Mong has been involved in this business for five years.

Mong is 26 years old and she is married with one child.  She is the leader of an eight member group, the 030715-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2011, Mong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Mong has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Mong faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Mong hopes for her business to do well, to buy a cell phone and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Buena Vista. Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres de Vista Hermosa este duo esta intagrado por Faustina de 63 años vive en una colonia muy bonita llamada El Rosario, para llegar a su casa se debe caminar por la montaña en un extravío y llegar más rápido. Ella se dedica a la venta de chamarras, cosméticos y leña, sus hijos son todos casados ella es viuda, pero la siguen apoyando en sus ventas y negocios la cual las realiza desde hace 20 años. Ella dice que a pesar de su edad no quiere dejar de hacerlo porque es su vida y le encanta vender, es muy conocida por sus vecinas y muy apreciada y admirada por ser trabajadora en todo lugar y momento.  A pesar de su edad sigue pidiéndole a Dios muchos años de vida y seguir  ayudando  a las mujeres de su colonia para que puedan ser con su pareja un pilar de  trabajado y ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos.  Le hacen varios pedidos de leña y su sueño es distribuirlo en la colonia pero no cuenta con el capital necesario, y tiene necesidad de hacerles la petición de un crédito,para la compra de leña.  Su compañera la señora Ingrid Yolanda de 35 años, al lado de su esposo y sus tres hijos se dedica a la venta de medicina en general ya que ella conoce de medicina en la colonia por un curso de enfermería que estudio cuando era soltera, su sueño es llegar a tener una farmacia y ayudar a varias personas a poder sentirse mejor en momentos de enfermedad sin importar la hora y día, para que no tengan que subir al pueblo para sentirse bien. Ella cuenta que le piden mucha medicina y le llevan varias recetas, pero no cuenta con todo lo que le piden por los precios caros y no le alcanza el dinero para comprar.  Pide con todo su corazón apoyo a travez del préstamo y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes teniendo la medicina que pidan.
texts.en:
Duo Mujeres de Buena Vista Group ("women with great vision") is composed of two women.

Faustina, aged 63, lives in a very nice neighborhood called El Rosario. To reach her house one has to walk astray in the mountains to reach it faster. Faustina sells jackets, cosmetics and firewood. She is widowed and her children are all married, but they still support her in her sales and activities, which she has had for the past 20 years. She says that despite her age she does not want to quit her business, because it is her life and she really likes selling. She is well known, appreciated and admired by her neighbors because she works hard at all times and all places. Despite her age she asks God to grant her many years of life to allow her to keep on helping the women of her neighborhood, so that they can be pillars of hard work for their partners and offer the best possible to their children. Faustina got several requests for firewood and she wants to distribute it in her neighborhood, but she lacks the necessary capital and is forced to apply for a loan to buy firewood.

Her fellow group member is Señora Ingrid Yolanda, aged 35, who sells general medicine  in her neighborhood with her husband and their three children. She followed a nursing course before her marriage. She dreams of having a pharmacy and helping people to get better when they are sick, regardless of the day or the hour, so that they don't need to travel to the village to get better. She says that people ask for a lot of medicine and often have prescriptions, but she doesn't keep everything in stock because medicine is expensive and she doesn't have enough money to stock up. She wholeheartedly asks for support by way of a loan, so that she can meet the needs of her customers by having the requested medicine available.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Duo Los Apocentos Group

texts.es: Duo los Apocentos. Este Duo esta integrado por doña Alma Guadalupe, de 26 años de edad,tiene 1 hijo que esta pequeño,doña Alma se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica en su colonia, en la venta ella no tiene mucha competencia es por eso que quiere agrandar mas su negocio,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de una paca re ropa,actual mente ella vende ambulate pero al comprar la paca de ropa pondra un local y vendera alli,y por otra parte la señorita Ingrid Marleny se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario,en la comunidad donde ella vive, y nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Duo Los Aposentos Group ("the chambers") is composed of two women.

The first member is Doña Alma Guadalupe, aged 26 and the mother of a son who is still very young. Alma sells traditional clothes in her neighborhood. Her business does not have much competition, which is why she wants to expand it. She applies for this loan to buy one bale of clothes. Currently she sells from door to door, but once she has bought the additional bale she will get premises where to sell the goods.

The group has a second member: Señorita Ingrid Marleny sells products of everyday consumption in her neighborhood. She applies for this loan to buy more goods of everyday consumption.

loans.use: to buy one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan, de oficio agricultor originario de Estelí, con mas de 30 años de dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas, nos expresa su agradecimiento por la ayuda brindada atravez del préstamo Kiva el cual a lo largo de todo este tiempo ha sido fundamental en su negocio para sobrevivir. En esta ocasión esta requiriendo el préstamo para cultivar 1/2 manzana de tomates y comprar los insumos necesarios para el mantenimiento de este cultivo. El dice que va a continuar con la siembra de cebolla, tomate, pepino, repollo, chiltoma cada una en pequeñas cantidades y un cultivo a la vez pues su objetivo es seguir trabajado para ir cambiando poco a poco su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Juan is a farmer and comes from Estelí. He has been growing vegetables for more than 30 years and he tells us that he is grateful for the help that has been offered to him by the Kiva loan he had before which has been essential to the survival of his business during this time. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to cultivate about an acre of land for tomatoes and to buy the supplies necessary to care for this crop. He says that he is going to continue sowing onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, and peppers, each one in a small quantity and to harvest each in its turn. His goal is to continue working in order to change his standard of living little by little.

loans.use: to cultivate about an acre of land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 28 years old and married with two children. She sells plastic basins, plates and cups; she has been in the business for two years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic basins, plates and cups to sell.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins, plates and cups to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thirty-one years old. She's from Naivasha and is married with two children who are both in school.

Lydia has a shop where she sells soft drinks. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy more stock of assorted soft drinks to sell. Lydia is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Azzir

texts.en:
Azzir is a 35-year-old man and is married to Merly, a 33-year-old lady. They are blessed with two children, namely: Cantika, 13, studying at the first grade of Junior High School and Andry, 12, studying at the 6th grade of Elementary School. 

Azzir owns a repair shop business, inherited from his father. Azzir has been engaged in this business for years. From the business he is able to generate money for his family's daily needs and the schooling fees of his children. Azzir was thinking to improve his business by adding more spare parts. He was seeking for a capital assistance to do so. 

One day, he met TLM’s loan officer and got information on the Individual Lending Program. He is interested in joining the program and requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,500,000. He plans to spend the loan on spark plugs, inner tubes, etc. Azzir hopes that TLM will help him in improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase spark plugs, inner tubes, etc.

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun, thirty-eight, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Elean, a housewife and mother to their three children. Edmun, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edmun maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives a tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts early in the morning and works until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evenings until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of the business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Edmun hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Electrine

texts.en:
Electrine is a thirty-eight years old, a single mother of three children aged between twelve and eighteen. She is from Mumias Town in Western Kenya.

Electrine operates a grocery in Mumias town. She has been doing this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,500. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more grocery goods like vegetables and tomatoes for her stall.

She will use the profits to boost her stock. Her dream is to provide the best living standards for her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erasmus

texts.en:
Erasmus is a 28-year-old single farmer. After graduating from high school, Erasmus decided to work as a farmer.  

Erasmus rents a plot of land and cultivates corn, nuts, and cucumbers. To earn more income for his family, Erasmus has been selling fertilizer, vitamins and seedlings since a year ago. Recently, Erasmus needed to spend his money on his brother’s schooling fees so he could not buy the stock in a large quantity. The limitation of capital drove him to seek a loan. 

Erasmus used to be a member of TLM’s group lending program. As he needs a larger loan now, he is requesting an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to purchase seeds, various kinds of fertilizer and pesticides. He is hoping that TLM will give him another chance to get the loan for his business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, different kinds of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old. She is a single mother of one child aged 24 years old. She operates a beauty salon and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of hair weaves, hair relaxers and beauty products. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET client.

Her dream is to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add stock of hair weaves, hair relaxers and beauty products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is forty-nine years old, the mother of three children. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is twenty-five years old, married, with two children. He sells household goods such as utensils and electronics. He has been in the business for six years and employs one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve the living standards of his family and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy electronics and utensils.

loans.use: To buy electronics and utensils.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is fifty-four years old, married, with seven children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and employs three people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Maria Debora

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy caracterizada por trabajadora y bondadosa con las demás personas. Con 56 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de 5 hijos.
Maria siempre ha querido colaborarle a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, pues con los ingresos que genera su esposo no es suficiente para afrontar a totalidad los gastos que se generan en su hogar.
Maria se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad gracias a la cual genera ingresos para su hogar.
Maria sueña con tener un gran negocio y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.

Con el ánimo de aprovechar productos en descuento, Maria quiere realizar una compra por gran cantidad de los productos que ofrece, de tal manera que cuando los venda tenga un margen de rentabilidad más alto. 
Maria, sin embargo, no cuenta en la actualidad con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de estos productos, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de belleza.

Maria aspira que sus ventas sigan incrementándose como lo han venido haciendo, y poder seguir colaborando en gran parte de los ingresos del hogar.
Maria quiere que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, y espera que sus hijos puedan ingresar a una educación superior.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who can be characterized as hardworking and kind to others. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children.
Maria has always wanted to join her husband in being responsible for covering the household expenses, and her husband's salary is not enough to cover all the costs that come up at home. 
Maria has been working for more than 10 years selling beauty products from a catalog, and this work generates profits that help with the household expenses. Maria dreams of having a big store and being able to employ people who need the work.
Maria wants to make a bulk purchase of the products that she sells so that she can buy at discount. In this way, when she sells her products she will have a higher profit margin.
However, Maria doesn't currently have sufficient capital to make this purchase, and so she hopes that a loan will giver her the opportunity to buy the beauty products. 
Maria hopes that her sales keep increasing as they have been doing, and that she is able to keep contributing significantly to the household income. Maria wants her children to have a good education and hopes that they can access higher education.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Duo Vicion De Fe Group

texts.es: Duo Vicion de Fe: este duo esta integrado por la señora Elica Marleni, y la señora Haydee las dos son casadas y tiene 3 hijos, y esta estudiando en una escuela de la comunidad donde viven,Doña Haydee de 41 años de edad  se dedica a la elavoracion de tortillas, actual mente saca sus tortillas en comal de leña pero  ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leña y una estufa indutrial y para comprar maiz por quintal,ya que en esta temporada el maiz no esta tan caro,doña Elica tiene 39 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo,ella quiere aprovechar porque en el mes de febrero es cuando mas se vende,esperan que se les pueda ayudar con el credito solicitando y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Duo Visión de Fe Group ("the vision of faith") is composed of two women, Señora Elica Marleni and Señora Haydee, both married.

Haydee, aged 41, is the mother of three children who attend a local school. She prepares tortillas. Currently she makes them on a firewood-heated plate. She applies for this loan to buy firewood, invest in an industrial stove and buy corn in bulk, because right now corn is not so expensive.

Elica, aged 39, sells cosmetics via catalogue. She wants to stock up because February is the month with the best sales.

Both group members hope that you can help them with the requested loan to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and an industrial stove for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Duo Amor De Los Amores. Group

texts.es:
DUO AMOR DE LOS AMORES

Doña Teresa y doña Silvia Elizabeth son dos mujeres trabajadoras que día a día se dedican a sus actividades ya que ellas se han dado cuenta que la vida hoy en día es muy dura, y se dedican a la compra y venta de laurel  es el medio que ellas tienen para poder sostener a sus familias, doña teresa se dedica también a la crianza de animales  y cuenta con una pequeña granjita en su casa el sueño de ellas es darles lo mejor a su familia a través del trabajo de ellas por eso  solicitan un crédito kiva porque han escuchado que es de mucho beneficio para las familias. Ellas quieren este crédito para poder ampliar mas su negocio ya que ellas viajan hacia la capital a entregar sus productos y a veces les hacen pedidos por mayor y ellas no cuentan con el capital necesario para entregar dichos pedidos necesitan de una mano amiga y esperan ser apoyadas para el beneficio de sus familias.
texts.en: Duo Amor de los Amores Group ("the love of loves") is composed of two women. Doña Teresa and Doña Silvia Elizabeth are hard-working women who day after day carry on with their activities, because they have realized that life is harsh. They sell bay leaves, which is their way to support their families. Doña Teresa also breeds animals and has a small farm at home. The two women dream of offering the best possible life to their families through their work. Therefore, they apply for a Kiva loan because they heard that it is very beneficial to their families. They want this loan to expand their businesses as they travel to Guatemala City to deliver their products and sometimes they place bulk orders, but lack the necessary capital to fulfill those orders. They need a helping hand and hope to be supported for the benefit of their families.

loans.use: to buy bay leaves in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Julia Dalila

texts.es:
Julia, originaria de Pueblo Nuevo , Esteli de 56 años dice que el  crédito Kiva fue un gran beneficio para ella pues gracias esa oportunidad que le dieron logro comprar insumos para sembrar tabaco, vender la cosecha y también utilizo parte del préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas. Además de sentirse desarrollada como agricultora donde tradicionalmente era el hombre que se dedicaba a trabajar en la tierra.
Ahora ella quiere cumplir uno de sus sueños como es ir mejorando su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito para comprar material de construcción para reparar su casa. En su negocio quiere ir ampliando sus terrenos de siembra para poder sembrar variedad de hortalizas.
texts.en:
56 year old Julia is from Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. She says that her previous Kiva loan was a great benefit to her and that, thanks to that opportunity that was given to her, she has been able to buy supplies for sowing tobacco, sold the crop, and also used part of the loan to buy agricultural supplies. She also feels that that she has developed as a farmer in an area where, traditionally, it has been the men who have worked the land.
Now, she wants to bring about one of her dreams, which is to improve her home. So, she is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to repair her house. In her business, she wants to increase her cultivated land so that she can grow a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is thirty-five years old, married, with two children. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve the living standards of his family and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 95,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 53 years old and married with five children. She does photography to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been  able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Jorge Alirio

texts.es:
Jorge ha sido una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy emprendedora y dedicada a su trabajo y su familia.
Anteriormente Jorge aprendió a hacer traperos y escobas y las elaboraba solo para el uso de su casa o de algunos familiares. Al ver que el producto gustó, Jorge empezó a comercializarlo por el sector y tuvo mucha acogida. Gracias a esto, Jorge encontró una fuente de ingresos que le permitió sacar a su esposa adelante. Jorge actualmente con 55 años de edad, ya también aprendió a fabricar detergentes, por lo que también los hace y los vende junto con sus traperos y escobas.

Jorge cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que lo tienen como un referente por la buena calidad de sus productos, y gracias a esto sus ventas han venido aumentando considerablemente.
Jorge actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de uno de sus clientes, para la elaboración de unos detergentes y unas traperas, por lo que Jorge requiere de la compra de materias primas para hacerlo, puesto que no tiene mucha cantidad.
Sin embargo, Jorge no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas para elaborar los detergentes y las traperas, y de este modo responder con el pedido de sus clientes.

Jorge espera que sus ventas sigan aumentando como lo han venido haciendo, y de este modo pueda generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.
Jorge sueña con que su negocio se expanda y venda productos en otras ciudades, por esto siempre busca la forma de encontrar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is a person who can be characterized as very enterprising and dedicated to his work and his family.
In the past, Jorge learned to make mops and brooms, and he made these just for use in his own home or for some family members. On seeing that these were popular, Jorge began to sell them commercially and had a good reception. Thanks to this, Jorge found a source of income that helped him to support his wife. Jorge is 55 years old and has also learned to make detergents and sells them along with his mops and brooms.
Jorge has many customers and this is an indication of the quality of his products. As a result, his sales have been growing considerably.
Jorge currently has a big order from one of his clients to make some detergents and mops, and so Jorge needs to buy the raw materials to make them because he doesn't have much in stock.
However, Jorge doesn't have sufficient capital to make these purchases and he hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy the raw materials to make the detergents and mops, and so to meet the order his customer has placed.  
Jorge hopes that his sales keep growing as they have been doing, and in this way he can generate more income for his home. 
Jorge dreams that his business will expand and he will be able to sell in other cities, and so he his always looking for ways to get more customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make detergents and mops.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is a 31-year-old man and is married to Emilia, a 31-year-old lady. They have been blessed with a daughter namely Putri, a 6-year-old little girl, attending kindergarten.

Rudy has been running a repair shop business for 6 months. Prior to running the business, Rudy used to work at a cooperative as an accounting staff member. After he had a terrible motorcycle accident last year, Rudy resigned from his job. After recovery, Rudy decided to initiate a repair shop business at home by using his own small capital. Day after day, Rudy gets customers so he can cover his family’s living expenses. 

Recently, some customers asked Rudy to re-paint their car; Rudy thinks this is a good chance to earn more money. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to do this. He would like to buy some materials and equipment such paint, sandpaper, thinner and putty. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. Rudy hopes that he will get the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment such as paint, sandpaper, thinner and putty.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 33 years old and married with three children. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in selling old shoes where he has spent two years. He got his capital from his relatives.

Joseph faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are to educate his future children and build a permanent home, and his business goal is to expand his business into new markets or areas. To Joseph, the purpose of the loan is to purchase more shoes for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for the business.

loans.name: Jaime Andres

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor manera como se puede conocer a Jaime, un joven que a su corta edad ha decidido buscar su propio sustento y ha querido que sus padres puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, por esto trabaja todos los días fuertemente para generar buenos ingresos con los cuales les pueda colaborar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.

Jaime se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 5 años a la venta de mercancía como ropa, lencería, electrodomésticos, entre otros, y los vende puerta a puerta en su municipio. Jaime, gracias a esta actividad, genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con sus 2 padres.
Jaime actualmente tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que requiere comprar mercancía para responder con los pedidos, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital para realizar las compras puesto que sus clientes le pagan una vez entregado el producto, y a veces pagan en varias cuotas. Es por esto que Jaime espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar productos como lencería, ropa, electrodomésticos, entre otros, para venderle a sus clientes.	

Jaime espera que con la compra de esta mercancía, sus clientes puedan quedar satisfechos y sus ventas sigan incrementándose de manera significativas. Además, sueña que con los ingresos superiores que conseguirá en un futuro, pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Enterprising is the best way to describe Jaime, a young man who has decided to seek his own livelihood and who wants his parents to have a better quality of life.  For these reasons he works very hard every day to generate a good income so he can help his parents with the household expenses.  

Jaime has been selling merchandise such as clothing, linens, appliances and other products for 5 years.  He sells door to door in his town. Thanks to this activity, Jaime generates enough income to support the household where he lives with both his parents.  Jaime currently has large orders from his customers so he needs to purchase merchandise to fill those orders, however, he doesn't have the capital since his customers pay him when they receive their merchandise and sometimes, they make several payments.  Jaime is hoping that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy products such as linens, clothing, appliances and other merchandise to sell to his customers. 

Jaime hopes that with the purchase of this merchandise his customers will remain satisfied and his sales will continue to significantly increase.  In addition, he dreams that with a higher income he will be able to secure a better quality of life for his parents.

loans.use: purchase linens, clothing, appliances and other products.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es:
Emprendimiento es la mejor palabra con la que se pueda caracterizar a Yonatan, un joven que desde muy temprana edad ha estado interesado en generar sus propios ingresos y aportar a su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos. Yonatan, aprendió a trabajar fuertemente gracias a su papá, quien fue una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia.

Yonatan tiene su negocio de ferretería desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, y hasta el momento a tenido muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes. Yonatan busca que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y más reconocido por parte de sus clientes.
Debido a que el negocio está tan reciente, Yonatan no tiene mucha mercancía disponible para sus clientes, por lo que busca comprar más productos de ferretería que le permitan tener un mejor surtido para atender a sus clientes. Sin embargo, Yonatan no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de esta mercancía, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de ferretería que le permitan tener una mayor variedad y con la cual sus clientes queden más satisfechos.

Yonatan espera que con mayor mercancía en su negocio, sus clientes puedan encontrar todas sus necesidades satisfechas, y de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente.
Además, Yonatan sueña que con unos ingresos superiores, les pueda brindar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, y una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Enterprising is the best word that can be applied to Yonatan, a young man who from an early age has been interested in generating his own income and contributing to the household costs. Yonatan learned how to work hard thanks to his father, who was a hardworking person who was dedicated to his family. 

Yonatan has had his hardware store for approximately 1 year. So far it has been well received by his customers. Yonatan is looking to make his business bigger and more well known with his customers.

Due to the newness of his business, Yonatan doesn't have a lot of merchandise available for his customers. That is why he is looking to buy more hardware products that will allow him to have a better variety to serve his customers. Nonetheless, Yonatan doesn't have enough capital to buy this merchandise, so he hopes that the loan will allow him to have the chance to buy the hardware products that will allow him to have more variety with which his customers will be more satisfied. 

Yonatan hopes that with more merchandise fr his business, his customers can find everything they need and thus his sales will increase considerably. IN addition, Yonatan's dream is that with more income, he can offer his parents a better quality of life and more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hardware products to stock his business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es originario de El Coyolito una comunidad de la Concordia municipio de Jinotega al norte de Estelí, se dedica a la siembra de cebolla, tomate, maíz y frijol , lleva 40 años trabajando en la agricultura. El tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura comenzó ayudando a prepara la tierra, limpiaba el terreno, alimentaba a los animales poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia que le sirvió para independizarse y sembrar por si solo. Siembra maíz y frijol para consumo de la familia y para vender.  
Realizo el crédito para compra de insumos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para siembra de cebolla. Esta inversión le ayudar a sacar una producción de muy buena calidad y rendimiento. Su próxima meta es sembrar un área mayor de cebolla.
texts.en:
Juan is from El Coyolito, a community in Concordia in the town of Jinotega, north of Estelí. He grows onions, tomatoes, corn and beans. He has been a farmer for 40 years. He has 6 children who are all grown. His father taught him to work in farming. He started helping to prepare the soil, clearing the land, feeding the animals and little by little acquired experience that helped him become independent and plant on his own. He plants corn and beans for his family to eat and to sell.  
  
He took out the loan to buy materials and fertilizer and to pay for labor to plant onions. This investment will help him have a good quality crop with a good yield. His next goal is to plant a larger area with onions.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to plant onions.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo in the place where he is selling fruit and vegetables. Eman is a 32-year-old woman, a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs,  and to improve his income and provide better living conditions to his family, he has been working selling fruit and vegetables for three years, which has been a profitable project.

Eman is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing bulk amounts of fruits and vegetables to resell upon customers' request. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old. She is from Engineer in Ndunyu Njeru and is married to Simon. They have three children who are in primary school.

Hellen is a farmer who is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. She is optimistic that her farm will do well after the loan.

She hopes to own a pickup in the near future to enable her to transport milk.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anne Plus Group

texts.en:
Hélène is the chairwoman of a Community Bank named “Anne Plus”, made up of 16 members, firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Hélène sells "shikwanges" (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which are Kinshasa’s main food. She sells in a market located to the eastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 1978. She has taken out twelve loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. With the next loan, Anne will be able to meet the customer demand and generate additional profit. Her business makes US$30 of profit per week. Hélène is 52 years old, married and has eight children aged between 18 and 33 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to meet the customer demand for a kind of bread made of manioc flour.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old and married  with three children. She has been in beauty salon business for 12 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blowdryer.

loans.use: To buy  a hair blowdryer.

loans.name: Ekal

texts.en:
Ekal is 34 years old. He is married to Jane; together, they have three children aged 7, 4 and 2 years old. He operates a motorcycle. He also sells charcoal, and he has been in the business for the past four years. He gets a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings from his business

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase more stock for resale in his business. This will help him accumulate capital to purchase a motorcycle.

He was brought to KADET LTD  by a KADET  LTD client. He hopes to accumulate profit that will enable him to purchase another motorbike.

loans.use: to diversify his business by buying more stock for resale in order to accumulate capital to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
Bikamwa Plus is a group of 11 owners of small businesses chaired by André. The members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC to grow their businesses.

André is determined to be a successful businessman. He sells pagnes (varying lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at the market located in the west of Kinshasa. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 1999. André has already received six loans from HOPE DRC, a micro-finance institution, and has fully repaid them as well. 

He intends to use the new loan to expand his inventory and diversify his business by adding the sales of vegetable oil. Currently he earns a profit of $50 a week. He will seek to make more profit by importing the products himself. His dream is to become a pagne wholesaler. André is 38 years old, married and a father of three children aged between 3 and 7 years old. One of them attends school.

loans.use: to increase the business inventory by buying more pagnes to meet her clients' demand and generate additional profits.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a 50-year-old fishmonger in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is a divorced mother of four. She has been selling fish for the past two years successfully. 

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more fish for sale to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Roc Plus Group

texts.en:
Ntotolo is the leader of the Community Bank named “Roc Plus”. It is composed of 14 members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Ntotolo is 30 years old and the father of three children whose ages vary between 6 months and 2 years old. He has been active in his business since 1996. He sells beverages and fresh food in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has already taken out seven loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. 

Thanks to Hope’s loans, his business has prospered and it generates a profit of $100 per week. Ntotolo intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying some crates of drinks and some bags of fresh food to resell at profit and increase his income. His ambition is to diversify his business and become a provider in his environment. He works hard in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying some fresh foods and reselling them at profit.

loans.name: Merci Plus Group

texts.en:
Mante is a leader of the community bank named “Merci Plus” which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs, united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mante sells plastic items and salted fish in the western area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 1997. His beginning capital was $50. Currently, through his sales, Mante makes about $40 per week. He plans to use the next loan to purchase some more plastic items and two bags of salted fish to resell at profit in order to increase his income. 

Mante is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having nine times received and properly repaid loans. He dreams one day of becoming a fish provider in his area. Mante is 34 years old, married and the father of two children whose ages are 3 and 7. One of them attends school.

loans.use: to purchase some more plastic items and two bags of salted fish to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Cruz Elena ha trabajado gran parte de su vida en el negocio de las comidas, pues antes atendía en un restaurante y poco a poco se ha ido independizando para preparar sus propias comidas y vendérselas a sus clientes. Cruz Elena se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos, a los cuales siempre les ha querido brindar lo mejor posible. Debido a que el salario que gana su esposo no es suficiente para poder sostener todos los gastos del hogar, Cruz Elena decidió montar su propio negocio de comidas como morcilla, tamales, pasteles de pollo, entre otros, y los vende a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos; gracias a esto genera los ingresos suficientes para contribuir al sostenimiento de su hogar. 

En la actualidad Cruz Elena debe realizar algunas mejoras a su cocina, pues las autoridades de sanidad le han hecho las sugerencias de mejorar algunas condiciones de su sitio de trabajo. Debido a que vende sus productos a crédito y sus clientes a menudo se retrazan en los pagos, Cruz Elena no cuenta en la actualidad con un gran capital, es por esto que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas a su cocina y poder cumplir con los requerimientos que le exigen las autoridades sanitarias. 

Cruz Elena espera que con esto pueda aumentar sus ventas, ya que por la condición actual algunos mercados no le abren la puerta, así que una vez hechas las mejoras a su cocina podrá comercializar sus productos a un número mayor de clientes. Cruz Elena sueña con que su negocio pueda convertirse en una gran comercializadora y que sus hijos puedan gozar de tener una estabilidad económica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Cruz Elena has worked most of her life in the food business.  She used to work in a restaurant but gradually became independent and began selling her own food to customers.  Cruz Elena is married and has two children for whom she has always wanted to provide the best she could.  Since her husband's salary is not enough to cover household expenses, Cruz Elena decided to set up her own business making blood pudding, tamales, chicken pies and other products which she sells to family, friends and neighbors.  She is able to generate enough income to contribute to household maintenance.

Currently Cruz Elena must make improvements in her kitchen since the health authorities made suggestions as to what she should do to upgrade her work site.  Since she sells her goods on a credit basis, and customers often get behind in their payments, Cruz Elena does not have much capital right now.  Therefore she is hopeful a loan will give her the opportunity to renovate her kitchen and be able to comply with the health authorities' requirements.

Cruz Elena hopes to increase sales because in the current conditions some markets are not open to her.  Once she has renovated her kitchen she can sell her products to more customers.  Cruz Elena's dream is to see her business grow significantly and that her children can enjoy a a stable economy in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her kitchen to comply with health authorities' requirements.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa, 46 years old, is married to Marwan who retired from the military and started working in the private sector. They have six sons and daughters. 

Kefa started a small home-based business to help support the family by doing a catering business only by order. She make different types of food and sweets based on the customer’s order, and she also provides food to parties and events.

Kefa has applied for a loan to buy new kitchen tools to enhance her service, and she hopes that in the near future she will be able to open her own separate kitchen to expand her catering business.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen tools to enhance her business.

loans.name: Charité Plus Group

texts.en:
Hélène is the leader of a Community bank named Charité Plus, which is composed of 10 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Hélène is 49 years old and the mother of three children aged between 7 and 16. All of her children attend school. Hélène runs a drugstore. She has been a micro entrepreneur since 1987. She is working hard to achieve her ambition of opening a cellphone booth and become financially independent. She is requesting a new loan to buy some more medicines to resell with the aim of increasing profits.

As she wanted to develop her business, she decided to join one of Hope’s groups. Hélène is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having received 12 loans so far and repaying them on time. She makes a profit of about $200 per month. She has succeeded with good strategies to build permanent customers. She always talks with her customers and she knows them well by their names, and her drugstore is always well-stocked.

loans.use: to increase her business inventory by buying some more medicine to resell and generate more profit.

loans.name: Athanus

texts.en:
Athanus is 38 years old. He is married with one child aged 8. He does carpentry to earn a living; he has been in the business for seven years and has employed two people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Francisco quien es empleado estatal, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos 16, 9 2 años de edad, habitando juntos en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Melita, es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, los cuales los traslada por el río Ucayali a los diversos caseríos donde los vende  a los pobladores. Algunas veces lo deja a crédito, pero en su mayoría al contado, logrando tener muchos clientes a lo largo de estos 04 años que lleva en ese negocio y contando además con la ayuda de su esposo en sus ratos libres y de descanso. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos,  así como el poder conocer otros lugares y nuevas personas, además de ver crecer su negocio a base de su esfuerzo. Por lo contrario, no le gusta el tener que estar lejos de casa y no poder cuidar de sus hijos pero sabe que lo hace por el bien de ellos. Con su esfuerzo busca brindarles un mejor calidad de vida, por eso se da fuerzas para hacer crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP,  por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido ya que ha encontrado apoyo por parte de todos. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como abarrotes a precio por mayor para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melita, 38, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead.  She lives with her common-law husband, Francisco who is a state employee.  They have three children, ages 16, 9 and 2 and they live in their own house which they bought through much effort.  Melita sells essential groceries which she transports along the Ucayali River to sell to different rural communities.  Sometimes she sells on credit, but most transactions are done in cash.  In the four years she has been in business she has attracted many customers.  Her husband also helps her in his free time.

She enjoys her work because it gives her extra income to take care of expenses.  Also, she gets to know other places and new people, while observing how her business grows through hard work.  What she does not like so much is having to be away from home and not being able to care for the children, but she knows that what she is doing is in their interest.  Through her efforts she is trying to give them a better lifestyle, doing all she can to grow her business.

This is her 12th loan through the MFP institution.  She is counting on your help so she can meet her goals.  She is very comfortable with her communal bank because it is a united group and she has found support from everyone.  With the 2,000 PEN loan she plans to buy wholesale groceries to make a better profit.

loans.use: To buy essential products for her business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 27-year-old, single business lady in Mombasa. She owns an electronics shop, a business she has been in for the past year. She is doing great. 

This is Sharon’s first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more bulbs, electrical wires and sockets. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock and repay her loan. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase more bulbs, electrical wires and sockets

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married man, age 55 years old, and blessed with three children, ages 20, 16 and 12 years old. His spouse is Liza, a business lady. Joel is a fish seller and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. This being his first term loan, he wishes to use this amount to purchase more fish from the suppliers for resale. The profit will be used to repay the loan.

Joel's dream is to become the most famous fish supplier in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Redempter

texts.en: Redempter is 59 years old, married with 7 children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 15,000 KES to buy beans, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy beans, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 39 years old, married with two children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 KES to buy sweaters and skirts.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and skirts

loans.name: Carol

texts.es: Carol, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa decidida a salir adelante. Convive con Tito, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 5 y 2 años  de edad a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa, inmueble que compró con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Carol, es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, que los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, para ello realiza viajes periódicos. Tiene más de 03 años realizando está actividad, contando con el apoyo de su mamá en la ventas y cobranza de los créditos entregados. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado buenas ganancias, logrando vender hasta 100 prendas al mes. Tiene planes de abrir una tienda comercial de venta de ropa en algunas zona comercial de la ciudad, para así no tener que caminar mucho buscando clientes. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más ropas de diversos modelos a precio por mayor buscando menores precios.
texts.en:
Carol, 26, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead.  She lives with her common-law husband, Tito, and they have two children, ages 5 and 2, whom they love very much.  They live comfortably in their own home which they bought through much effort.  Carol sells women's, men's and children's clothing which she buys in the city of Lima, where she travels periodically.  She has been in business for over three years with the support of her mother who helps out with sales and credit collections.  

She enjoys her business because of the good profits it generates.  Sometimes she sells as many as 100 garments a month.  She plans to open a clothing shop in one of the commercial areas of the city so she does not have to walk to find customers.  This is her third loan through the MFP institution and she is counting on your support to continue seeking her goals.  She is comfortable with her communal bank because it is a unified, supportive group.  The 1,200 PEN loan will be used to buy more wholesale clothes in different styles at better prices.

loans.use: To buy more clothing at better prices.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 42 years old, married to Teresiah, and together they are blessed with four children.


Charles runs a bicycle repair business in Nguluni; Tala. He has been in this business for the last 19 years. Charles is applying for his third loan of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD. He plans to buy spare parts with the loan money.


Charles hopes to educate his children and grow his business to a sustainable one.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 65 years old. He is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two children who are in secondary school.

Jerry is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy maize seedlings and pay for labor. He also needs some spraying chemicals to help his crops to grow well.

He hopes to be the best farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy spraying chemicals and seedlings.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ahmad appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Khadeja is a 42-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and one daughter. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary. Khadeja and her husband work in agriculture raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Khadeja is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing more sheep and olive seedlings. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and olive seedlings.

loans.name: Fekrieh

texts.en:
Fekrieh is 53 years old and a mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a municipality employee who gets a low salary but enough to cover the family's costs. Fekrieh is requesting a loan from FATEN to help cover her costs for purchasing new bedroom furniture for her children. This will offer better living conditions to her family members. Fekrieh is photographed in a FATEN branch.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for her children.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 7 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to increase more in the business. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Grace, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken for resale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a thirty-five year old man from Kisumu city. He is married to Florence. and they have two children aged twelve and eight.

Richard operates a mobile phone airtime (locally known credit cards) business and has been doing this for the last ten years.  From the business, he makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking a first loan from KADET Ltd. which he will use to buy more airtime cards for sale. 

He will use his profits to stock his airtime cards. His dream is to sell airtime cards at wholesale to other vendors

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime to sell.

loans.name: Tubulwanyise Naluvule Group

texts.en:
Notching up any semblance of success in any business undertaking calls for lots of unwavering commitment, purposefulness and needless to say, a sense of diligence.

Fifty-eight-year-old Dezi, a widowed mother of four, has exemplified many of the aforementioned virtues the last decade as she goes about her poultry sales business in Kampala. She also ekes out a side income from farming. She says she will use her loan money to purchase more poultry to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to sell.

loans.name: Kariuki

texts.en:
Kariuki is forty-six years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married to Grace; they have four children who are all in school.

Kariuki has been rearing sheep for sale. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd, to enable him purchase more sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

He hopes to become a leading businessman in his area.

loans.use: To buy more sheep to rear.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is thirty-five years old, married with one child. She sells men and women's suits to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men and women's suits to sell.

loans.use: To buy men and women's suits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essential groceries and offer more variety to customers.

loans.name: Tania Alejandra
